   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %% There are some environment variables that can be used to "manipulate"
   22: %% the test suite: 
   23: %%
   24: %% Variable that controls which 'groups' are to run (with default values)
   25: %%
   26: %%         ESOCK_TEST_REG:         include
   27: %%         ESOCK_TEST_MON:         include
   28: %%         ESOCK_TEST_IOCTL:       include
   29: %%         ESOCK_TEST_SOCK_CLOSE:  include
   30: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TICKETS:     include
   31: %%
   32: %% Variable that controls "verbosity" of the test case(s):
   33: %%
   34: %%         ESOCK_TEST_QUIET: true (default) | false
   35: %%
   36: 
   37: %% Run the entire test suite: 
   38: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]).
   39: %%
   40: %% Run a specific group:
   41: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   42: %%
   43: %% Run a specific test case:
   44: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   45: %%
   46: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   47: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   48: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   49: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   50: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}]) end.
   51: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   52: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   53: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   54: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   55: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   56: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   57: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   58: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   59: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   60: %%
   61: %% Some official info about AF_UNIX
   62: %% https://devblogs.microsoft.com/commandline/windowswsl-interop-with-af_unix/
   63: 
   64: 
   65: 
   66: -module(socket_SUITE).
   67: 
   68: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   69: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   70: -include("socket_test_evaluator.hrl").
   71: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   72: 
   73: %% Suite exports
   74: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0]).
   75: -export([init_per_suite/1,    end_per_suite/1,
   76:          init_per_group/2,    end_per_group/2,
   77:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   78: 
   79: %% Test cases
   80: -export([

   82:          reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count/1,

  173: 
  174: -define(SLIB,       socket_test_lib).
  175: -define(KLIB,       kernel_test_lib).
  176: -define(LOGGER,     socket_test_logger).

  182: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  183: 
  184: suite() ->
  185:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]},
  186:      {timetrap, {minutes,1}}].
  187: 
  188: all() -> 
  189:     Groups = [{reg,          "ESOCK_TEST_REG",        include},
  190:               {monitor,      "ESOCK_TEST_MON",        include},
  191:               {ioctl,        "ESOCK_TEST_IOCTL",      include},
  192: 	      {socket_close, "ESOCK_TEST_SOCK_CLOSE", include},
  193: 	      {tickets,      "ESOCK_TEST_TICKETS",    include}],
  194:     [use_group(Group, Env, Default) || {Group, Env, Default} <- Groups].
  195: 
  196: use_group(_Group, undefined, exclude) ->
  197:     [];
  198: use_group(Group, undefined, _Default) ->
  199:     [{group, Group}];
  200: use_group(Group, Env, Default) ->
  201: 	case os:getenv(Env) of
  202: 	    false when (Default =:= include) ->
  203: 		[{group, Group}];
  204: 	    false ->
  205: 		[];
  206: 	    Val ->
  207: 		case list_to_atom(string:to_lower(Val)) of
  208: 		    Use when (Use =:= include) orelse 
  209: 			     (Use =:= enable) orelse 
  210: 			     (Use =:= true) ->
  211: 			[{group, Group}];
  212: 		    _ ->
  213: 			[]
  214: 		end
  215: 	end.
  216:     
  217: 
  218: groups() -> 
  219:     [{reg,                         [], reg_simple_cases()},
  220: 
  221:      {monitor,                     [], monitor_cases()},
  222: 
  223:      {socket_close,                [], socket_close_cases()},
  224:      {sc_ctrl_proc_exit,           [], sc_cp_exit_cases()},
  225:      {sc_local_close,              [], sc_lc_cases()},
  226:      {sc_remote_close,             [], sc_rc_cases()},
  227:      {sc_remote_shutdown,          [], sc_rs_cases()},
  228: 
  229:      {ioctl,                       [], ioctl_cases()},
  230:      {ioctl_simple,                [], ioctl_simple_cases()},
  231:      {ioctl_get,                   [], ioctl_get_cases()},
  232:      {ioctl_set,                   [], ioctl_set_cases()},
  233: 
  234:      %% Ticket groups
  235:      {tickets,                     [], tickets_cases()},
  236:      {otp16359,                    [], otp16359_cases()},
  237:      {otp18240,                    [], otp18240_cases()}
  238:     ].
  239:

  244:      reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count
  245:     ].
  246:

  253:      monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close,

  261:      monitor_closed_socket
  262:     ].

  265: %% These cases tests what happens when the socket is closed/shutdown,
  266: %% locally or remotely.
  267: socket_close_cases() ->

  270:      {group, sc_local_close},
  271:      {group, sc_remote_close},
  272:      {group, sc_remote_shutdown}
  273:     ].
  274:

  276: %% exits *without* explicitly calling socket:close/1.

  280:      sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6,

  284:      sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL
  285:     ].

  306:      sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp6,

  398: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  399: 
  400: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  401:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  402:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  403:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  404:     
  405:     try socket:info() of
  406:         #{} ->
  407:             case ?KLIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  408:                 {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  409:                     SKIP;
  410: 
  411:                 Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  412: 
  413:                     ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  414:                        "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  415: 
  416:                     ?ENSURE_NOT_DOG_SLOW(Config1, 15),
  417: 
  418:                     %% We need a monitor on this node also
  419:                     kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  420: 
  421:                     socket:use_registry(false),
  422:                     case quiet_mode(Config1) of
  423:                         default ->
  424:                             case ?LOGGER:start() of
  425:                                 ok ->
  426:                                     Config1;
  427:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  428:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  429:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  430:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  431:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  432:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  433:                             end;
  434:                         Quiet ->
  435:                             case ?LOGGER:start(Quiet) of
  436:                                 ok ->
  437:                                     [{esock_test_quiet, Quiet} | Config1];
  438:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  439:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  440:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  441:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  442:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  443:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  444:                             end
  445:                     end
  446:             end
  447:     catch
  448:         error : notsup ->
  449:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
  450:         error : undef ->
  451:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
  452:     end.
  453: 
  454: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  455: 
  456:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  457:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  458:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  459: 
  460:     %% Stop the local monitor
  461:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  462: 
  463:     (catch ?LOGGER:stop()),
  464: 
  465:     Config1 = ?KLIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  466: 
  467:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  468:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  469: 
  470:     Config1.
  471: 
  472: 
  473: init_per_group(GroupName, Config)
  474:   when (GroupName =:= sc_remote_close) orelse
  475:        (GroupName =:= sc_remote_shutdown) ->
  476:     io:format("init_per_group(~w) -> entry with"
  477:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  478:               "~n", [GroupName, Config]),
  479:     %% Maybe we should skip the entire suite for this platform,
  480:     %% but for now we just skip these groups, which seem to 
  481:     %% have problems (node start).
  482:     %% As stated elsewhere, its not really Fedora 16, but 
  483:     %% the *really* slow VM that is the issue.
  484:     try is_old_fedora16() of
  485:         ok ->
  486:             Config
  487:     catch
  488:         throw:{skip, _} = SKIP ->
  489:             SKIP
  490:     end;
  491: init_per_group(GroupName, Config)
  492:   when (GroupName =:= ioctl) ->
  493:     io:format("init_per_group(~w) -> entry with"
  494:               "~n   Config:"
  495:               "~n      ~p"
  496:               "~nwhen"
  497:               "~n   Supported IOCtl Requests: "
  498:               "~n~s"
  499:               "~n   Supported IOCtl Flags: "
  500:               "~n~s"
  501:               "~n", [GroupName, Config,
  502:                      format_ioctls(socket:supports(ioctl_requests), 6),
  503:                      format_ioctls(socket:supports(ioctl_flags), 6)]),
  504:     Config;
  505: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  506:     Config.
  507: 
  508: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  509:     Config.
  510: 
  511: format_ioctls(Reqs, PrefixSz) ->
  512:     Max = format_ioctls_max(Reqs),
  513:     format_ioctls(Reqs, string:pad("", PrefixSz), Max).
  514: 
  515: format_ioctls_max(Reqs) ->
  516:     format_ioctls_max(Reqs, 0).
  517: 
  518: format_ioctls_max([], Max) ->
  519:     Max;
  520: format_ioctls_max([{Req, _}|Reqs], Max) when is_atom(Req) ->
  521:     ReqStr = atom_to_list(Req),
  522:     case length(ReqStr)+1 of
  523:         NewMax when (NewMax > Max) ->
  524:             format_ioctls_max(Reqs, NewMax);
  525:         _ ->
  526:             format_ioctls_max(Reqs, Max)
  527:     end.
  528: 
  529: format_ioctls(IOCtls, Prefix, Max) ->
  530:     format_ioctls(IOCtls, Prefix, Max, []).
  531: 
  532: format_ioctls([], _Prefix, _Max, Acc) ->
  533:     lists:flatten(lists:reverse(Acc));
  534: format_ioctls([{Key, Sup}|IOCtls], Prefix, Max, Acc) ->
  535:     format_ioctls(IOCtls, Prefix, Max,
  536:                   [format_ioctl(Key, Sup, Prefix, Max) | Acc]).
  537: 
  538: format_ioctl(Key, Sup, Prefix, Max) ->
  539:     KeyStr  = io_lib:format("~w:", [Key]),
  540:     KeyStr2 = lists:flatten(string:pad(KeyStr, Max, trailing, " ")),
  541:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~s~s ~w~n", [Prefix, KeyStr2, Sup])).
  542: 
  543: 
  544: init_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  545:     io:format("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry with"
  546:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  547:               "~n", [_TC, Config]),
  548:     Config.
  549: 
  550: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  551:     Config.
  552: 
  553: 
  554: quiet_mode(Config) ->
  555:     case lists:keysearch(esock_test_quiet, 1, Config) of
  556:         {value, {esock_test_quiet, Quiet}} ->
  557:             Quiet;
  558:         false ->
  559:             case os:getenv("ESOCK_TEST_QUIET") of
  560:                 "true"  -> true;
  561:                 "false" -> false;
  562:                 _       -> default
  563:             end
  564:     end.
  565: 
  566: 
  567: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  568: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  569: %%                                                                     %%
  570: %%                             REGISTRY                                %%
  571: %%                                                                     %%
  572: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  573: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  574: 
  575: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  576: %% We create a bunch of different sockets and ensure that the registry
  577: %% has the correct info.
  578: 
  579: reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  580:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
  581:     tc_try(reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count,
  582:            fun() ->
  583:                    ok = reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count()
  584:            end).
  585: 
  586: 
  587: reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count() ->
  588:     socket:use_registry(true),
  589: 
  590:     {OS, _} = os:type(),
  591: 
  592:     %% We may have some sockets already existing.
  593:     %% Make sure we dont count them when we test.
  594:     Existing = socket:which_sockets(),
  595:     N = length(Existing),
  596:     SupportsIPV6 =
  597:         case (catch has_support_ipv6()) of
  598:             ok ->
  599:                 true;
  600:             _ ->
  601:                 false
  602:         end,
  603:     SupportsLOCAL =
  604:         case (catch has_support_unix_domain_socket()) of
  605:             ok ->
  606:                 true;
  607:             _ ->
  608:                 false
  609:         end,
  610:     SupportsSCTP =
  611:         case (catch has_support_sctp()) of
  612:             ok ->
  613:                 true;
  614:             _ ->
  615:                 false
  616:         end,
  617:     InitSockInfos =
  618:         [
  619:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  620:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  621:         ] ++
  622:         case SupportsIPV6 of
  623:             true ->
  624:                 [
  625:                  {inet6, stream, tcp},
  626:                  {inet6, dgram,  udp}
  627:                 ];
  628:             false ->
  629:                 []
  630:         end ++
  631:         case SupportsLOCAL of
  632:             true when (OS =/= win32) ->
  633:                 [
  634:                  {local, stream, default},
  635:                  {local, dgram,  default}
  636:                 ];
  637:             true ->
  638:                 [
  639:                  {local, stream, default}
  640:                 ];
  641:             false ->
  642:                 []
  643:         end ++
  644:         [
  645:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  646:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  647:         ] ++
  648:         case SupportsSCTP of
  649:             true ->
  650:                 %% On some platforms this is not enough,
  651:                 %% we need to actually check this "by doing it"...
  652:                 ?P("test open sctp socket"),
  653:                 case socket:open(inet,
  654:                                  seqpacket,
  655:                                  sctp,
  656:                                  #{use_registry => false}) of
  657:                     {ok, S} ->
  658:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: success"),
  659:                         (catch socket:close(S)),
  660:                         [
  661:                          {inet, seqpacket, sctp},
  662:                          {inet, seqpacket, sctp}
  663:                         ];
  664:                     {error, _} ->
  665:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: failed"),
  666:                         []
  667:                 end;
  668:             false ->
  669:                 []
  670:         end ++
  671:         [
  672:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  673:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  674:         ] ++
  675:         case SupportsSCTP andalso SupportsIPV6 of
  676:             true ->
  677:                 %% On some platforms this is not enough,
  678:                 %% we need to actually check this "by doing it"...
  679:                 ?P("test open sctp socket"),
  680:                 case socket:open(inet6,
  681:                                  seqpacket,
  682:                                  sctp,
  683:                                  #{use_registry => false}) of
  684:                     {ok, S6} ->
  685:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: success"),
  686:                         (catch socket:close(S6)),
  687:                         [
  688:                          {inet6, seqpacket, sctp},
  689:                          {inet6, seqpacket, sctp}
  690:                         ];
  691:                     {error, _} ->
  692:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: failed"),
  693:                         []
  694:                 end;
  695:             false ->
  696:                 []
  697:         end,
  698: 
  699:     i("open sockets"),
  700:     Socks =
  701:         [fun({Domain, Type, Proto}) ->
  702:                  i("open socket: ~w, ~w, ~w", [Domain, Type, Proto]),
  703:                  {ok, Sock} = socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto),
  704:                  Sock
  705:          end(InitSockInfo) || InitSockInfo <- InitSockInfos],
  706: 
  707:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  708: 
  709: 
  710:     %% **** Total Number Of Sockets ****
  711: 
  712:     NumSocks1 = N + length(Socks),
  713:     NumberOf1 = socket:number_of(),
  714: 
  715:     i("verify (total) number of sockets(1): ~w, ~w",
  716:       [NumSocks1, NumberOf1]),
  717:     case (NumSocks1 =:= NumberOf1) of
  718:         true ->
  719:             ok;
  720:         false ->
  721:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sockets1, {NumSocks1, NumberOf1})
  722:     end,
  723: 
  724: 
  725:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 TCP Sockets ****
  726: 
  727:     %% inet, stream, tcp
  728:     SiNumTCP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, stream, tcp),
  729:     SrNumTCP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, stream, tcp),
  730: 
  731:     i("verify number of IPv4 TCP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumTCP, SrNumTCP]),
  732:     case (SiNumTCP =:= SrNumTCP) of
  733:         true ->
  734:             ok;
  735:         false ->
  736:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv4_tcp_sockets, {SiNumTCP, SrNumTCP})
  737:     end,
  738: 
  739: 
  740:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 UDP Sockets ****
  741: 
  742:     %% inet, dgram, udp
  743:     SiNumUDP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, dgram, udp),
  744:     SrNumUDP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, dgram, udp),
  745: 
  746:     i("verify number of IPv4 UDP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumUDP, SrNumUDP]),
  747:     case (SiNumUDP =:= SrNumUDP) of
  748:         true ->
  749:             ok;
  750:         false ->
  751:             exit({wrong_number_of_ipv4_udp_sockets, SiNumUDP, SrNumUDP})
  752:     end,
  753: 
  754: 
  755:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 SCTP Sockets ****
  756: 
  757:     %% inet, seqpacket, sctp
  758:     SiNumSCTP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, seqpacket, sctp),
  759:     SrNumSCTP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, seqpacket, sctp),
  760: 
  761:     i("verify number of IPv4 SCTP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumSCTP, SrNumSCTP]),
  762:     case (SiNumSCTP =:= SrNumSCTP) of
  763:         true ->
  764:             ok;
  765:         false ->
  766:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sctp_sockets, {SiNumSCTP, SrNumSCTP})
  767:     end,
  768: 
  769: 
  770:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 Sockets ****
  771: 
  772:     %% inet
  773:     SiNumINET = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet),
  774:     SrNumINET = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet),
  775: 
  776:     i("verify number of IPv4 sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumINET, SrNumINET]),
  777:     case (SiNumINET =:= SrNumINET) of
  778:         true ->
  779:             ok;
  780:         false ->
  781:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv4_sockets, {SiNumINET, SrNumINET})
  782:     end,
  783: 
  784: 
  785:     %% **** Number Of IPv6 Sockets ****
  786: 
  787:     %% inet6
  788:     SiNumINET6 = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet6),
  789:     SrNumINET6 = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet6),
  790: 
  791:     i("verify number of IPv6 sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumINET6, SrNumINET6]),
  792:     case (SiNumINET6 =:= SrNumINET6) of
  793:         true ->
  794:             ok;
  795:         false ->
  796:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv6_sockets, {SiNumINET6, SrNumINET6})
  797:     end,
  798: 
  799: 
  800:     %% **** Number Of Unix Domain Sockets Sockets ****
  801: 
  802:     %% local
  803:     SiNumLOCAL = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, local),
  804:     SrNumLOCAL = reg_sr_num(Existing, local),
  805: 
  806:     i("verify number of Unix Domain Sockets sockets: ~w, ~w",
  807:       [SiNumLOCAL, SrNumLOCAL]),
  808:     case (SiNumLOCAL =:= SrNumLOCAL) of
  809:         true ->
  810:             ok;
  811:         false ->
  812:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_local_sockets, {SiNumLOCAL, SrNumLOCAL})
  813:     end,
  814: 
  815: 
  816:     %% **** Close *all* Sockets then verify Number Of Sockets ****
  817: 
  818:     i("close sockets"),
  819:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
  820:                           i("close socket"),                          
  821:                           ok = socket:close(S)
  822:                   end, Socks),
  823: 
  824:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  825: 
  826:     NumberOf2 = socket:number_of(),
  827: 
  828:     i("verify number of sockets(2): ~w, ~w", [N, NumberOf2]),
  829:     case (N =:= NumberOf2) of
  830:         true ->
  831:             ok;
  832:         false ->
  833:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sockets2, {N, NumberOf2})
  834:     end,
  835: 
  836: 
  837:     i("verify owner sockets (none)", []),
  838:     Expected1 = [],
  839:     case socket:which_sockets(self()) of
  840:         Expected1 ->
  841:             ok;
  842:         Unexpected1 ->
  843:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets_own1, {Expected1, Unexpected1})
  844:     end,
  845: 
  846:     i("create some sockets", []),
  847:     OwnSockets = lists:sort(
  848:                    [fun({D, T})->
  849:                             i("create ~w:~w socket", [D, T]),
  850:                             {ok, OSocks} = socket:open(D, T, default),
  851:                             OSocks
  852:                     end(SockInfo) || SockInfo <-
  853:                                          [{inet, dgram},
  854:                                           {inet, dgram},
  855:                                           {inet, stream},
  856:                                           {inet, stream}]]),
  857: 
  858:     i("verify owner sockets (~w)", [length(OwnSockets)]),
  859:     case lists:sort(socket:which_sockets(self())) of
  860:         OwnSockets ->
  861:             ok;
  862:         Unexpected2 ->
  863:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets_own2, {OwnSockets, Unexpected2})
  864:     end,
  865: 
  866:     i("close (own) sockets"),
  867:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
  868:                           i("close socket"),                          
  869:                           ok = socket:close(S)
  870:                   end, OwnSockets),
  871:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  872: 
  873:     i("verify number of sockets(2) (again)"),
  874:     NumberOf2 = socket:number_of(),
  875: 
  876:     i("verify pre-existing sockets(2)", []),
  877:     case socket:which_sockets() of
  878:         Existing ->
  879:             ok;
  880:         OtherSockets ->
  881:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets2, {Existing, OtherSockets})
  882:     end,
  883: 
  884:     socket:use_registry(false),
  885:     ok.
  886: 
  887: 
  888: reg_si_fail(Reason, Extra) ->
  889:     socket:use_registry(false),
  890:     exit({Reason, Extra}).
  891: 
  892: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain)
  893:   when ((Domain =:= inet) orelse (Domain =:= inet6) orelse (Domain =:= local)) ->
  894:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, undefined, undefined);
  895: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Type)
  896:   when ((Type =:= stream) orelse (Type =:= dgram) orelse (Type =:= seqpacket)) ->
  897:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, Type, undefined);
  898: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Proto)
  899:   when ((Proto =:= sctp) orelse (Proto =:= tcp) orelse (Proto =:= udp)) ->
  900:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, undefined, Proto).
  901: 
  902: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, undefined, undefined) ->
  903:     F = fun({D, _T, _P}) when (D =:= Domain) -> true;
  904:            (_) -> false
  905:         end,
  906:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  907: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, Type, undefined) ->
  908:     F = fun({_D, T, _P}) when (T =:= Type) -> true;
  909:            (_) -> false
  910:         end,
  911:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  912: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, undefined, Proto) ->
  913:     F = fun({_D, _T, P}) when (P =:= Proto) -> true;
  914:            (_) -> false
  915:         end,
  916:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  917: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, Type, Proto) ->
  918:     F = fun({D, T, P}) when (D =:= Domain) andalso
  919:                             (T =:= Type) andalso
  920:                             (P =:= Proto) ->
  921:                 true;
  922:            (_) ->
  923:                 false
  924:         end,
  925:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo).
  926: 
  927: reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo) ->
  928:     length(lists:filter(F, SocksInfo)).
  929: 
  930: 
  931: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain)
  932:   when ((Domain =:= inet) orelse (Domain =:= inet6)) ->
  933:     length(socket:which_sockets(Domain) -- Existing);
  934: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain)
  935:   when (Domain =:= local) ->
  936:     reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, undefined, undefined);
  937: reg_sr_num(Existing, Type)
  938:   when ((Type =:= stream) orelse (Type =:= dgram) orelse (Type =:= seqpacket)) ->
  939:     length(socket:which_sockets(Type) -- Existing);
  940: reg_sr_num(Existing, Proto)
  941:   when ((Proto =:= sctp) orelse (Proto =:= tcp) orelse (Proto =:= udp)) ->
  942:     length(socket:which_sockets(Proto) -- Existing).
  943: 
  944: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, undefined, undefined) ->
  945:     F = fun(#{domain := D}) when (D =:= Domain) ->
  946:                 true;
  947:            (_X) ->
  948:                 false
  949:         end,
  950:     reg_sr_num2(Existing, F);
  951: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, Type, Proto) ->
  952:     F = fun(#{domain   := D,
  953:               type     := T,
  954:               protocol := P}) when (D =:= Domain) andalso
  955:                                    (T =:= Type) andalso
  956:                                    (P =:= Proto) ->
  957:                 true;
  958:            (_X) ->
  959:                 %% i("reg_sr_num -> not counting: "
  960:                 %%   "~n   ~p", [_X]),
  961:                 false
  962:         end,
  963:     reg_sr_num2(Existing, F).
  964: 
  965: reg_sr_num2(Existing, F) ->
  966:     length(socket:which_sockets(F) -- Existing).
  967: 
  968: 
  969: 
  970: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  971: %% We create a bunch of different sockets and ensure that the registry
  972: %% has the correct info.
  973: 
  974: reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  975:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
  976:     tc_try(reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count,
  977:            fun() ->
  978:                    ok = reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count()
  979:            end).
  980: 
  981: 
  982: reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count() ->
  983:     i("Make sure use of socket registry is enabled (regardless of default)"),
  984:     socket:use_registry(true),
  985:     #{use_registry := true} = socket:info(),
  986: 
  987:     i("get current socket base count"),
  988:     Base = socket:number_of(),
  989: 
  990:     i("create a socket and ensure its counted"),
  991:     {ok, S1} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp),
  992:     Base1 = Base + 1,
  993:     case socket:number_of() of
  994:         Base1 ->
  995:             ok;
  996:         Invalid1 -> 
  997:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets1, Invalid1, Base + 1})
  998:     end,
  999:     i("close the socket and ensure its counted (back to base)"),
 1000:     ok = socket:close(S1),
 1001:     case socket:number_of() of
 1002:         Base ->
 1003:             ok;
 1004:         Invalid2 -> 
 1005:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets2, Invalid2, Base})
 1006:     end,
 1007: 
 1008:     i("create a socket with use_registry explicitly off "
 1009:       "and ensure its not counted"),
 1010:     {ok, S2} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp, #{use_registry => false}),
 1011:     case socket:number_of() of
 1012:         Base ->
 1013:             ok;
 1014:         Invalid3 -> 
 1015:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets3, Invalid3, Base})
 1016:     end,
 1017:     i("close the socket and ensure its not counted"),
 1018:     ok = socket:close(S2),
 1019:     case socket:number_of() of
 1020:         Base ->
 1021:             ok;
 1022:         Invalid4 -> 
 1023:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets4, Invalid4, Base})
 1024:     end,
 1025: 
 1026:     i("Globally disable use of registry"),
 1027:     socket:use_registry(false),
 1028:     #{use_registry := false} = socket:info(),
 1029:     i("create a socket and ensure its not counted"),
 1030:     {ok, S3} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp),
 1031:     case socket:number_of() of
 1032:         Base ->
 1033:             ok;
 1034:         Invalid5 -> 
 1035:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets5, Invalid5, Base})
 1036:     end,
 1037:     i("close the socket and ensure its not counted"),
 1038:     ok = socket:close(S3),
 1039:     case socket:number_of() of
 1040:         Base ->
 1041:             ok;
 1042:         Invalid6 -> 
 1043:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets6, Invalid6, Base})
 1044:     end,
 1045: 
 1046:     i("create a socket with use_registry explicitly on "
 1047:       "and ensure its counted"),
 1048:     {ok, S4} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp, #{use_registry => true}),
 1049:     case socket:number_of() of
 1050:         Base1 ->
 1051:             ok;
 1052:         Invalid7 -> 
 1053:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets7, Invalid7, Base + 1})
 1054:     end,
 1055:     i("close the socket and ensure counted (back to base)"),
 1056:     ok = socket:close(S4),
 1057:     case socket:number_of() of
 1058:         Base ->
 1059:             ok;
 1060:         Invalid8 -> 
 1061:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets8, Invalid8, Base})
 1062:     end,
 1063: 
 1064:     socket:use_registry(false),
 1065:     i("done"),
 1066:     ok.
 1067: 
 1068: 
 1069: 
 1070: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1071: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1072: %%                                                                     %%
 1073: %%                       SOCKET MONITOR                                %%
 1074: %%                                                                     %%
 1075: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1076: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1077: 
 1078: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1079: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process then close socket.
 1080: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1081: 
 1082: monitor_simple_open_and_close(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1083:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1084:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_close,
 1085:            fun() ->
 1086: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1087:                                  type     => stream,
 1088:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1089:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_close(InitState)
 1090:            end).
 1091: 
 1092: 
 1093: mon_simple_open_and_close(InitState) ->
 1094:     OwnerSeq =
 1095:         [
 1096:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1097:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1098:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1099:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1100:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1101:                    end},
 1102:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1103:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1104:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1105:                            ok
 1106:                    end},
 1107: 
 1108:          %% *** Init part ***
 1109:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1110:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1111:                          type     := Type, 
 1112:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1113:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1114:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1115:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1116:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1117:                                    ERROR
 1118:                            end
 1119:                    end},
 1120:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1121:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1122:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1123:                            ok
 1124:                    end},
 1125: 
 1126:          %% The actual test
 1127:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 1128:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1129:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 1130:                    end},
 1131: 
 1132:          #{desc => "close socket",
 1133:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1134:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1135: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 1136:                    end},
 1137: 
 1138:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1139:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1140:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1141:                                ok ->
 1142:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1143:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1144:                                    ERROR
 1145:                            end
 1146:                    end},
 1147: 
 1148:          %% *** We are done ***
 1149:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1150:         ],
 1151: 
 1152:     TesterSeq =
 1153:         [
 1154:          %% *** Init part ***
 1155:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1156:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1157:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1158:                            ok
 1159:                    end},
 1160:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1161:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1162:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1163:                            ok
 1164:                    end},
 1165:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1166:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1167:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1168:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1169:                    end},
 1170:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1171:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1172: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1173: 			   ok
 1174:                    end},
 1175:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1176:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1177: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1178: 			   ok
 1179:                    end},
 1180:          #{desc => "monitor socket - create two",
 1181:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1182:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1183:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1184: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor(s): "
 1185: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 1186: 				       "~n   2: ~p", [MRef1, MRef2]),
 1187: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1, mon2 => MRef2}}
 1188:                    end},
 1189:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=2)",
 1190:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1191: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1192: 			   ok
 1193:                    end},
 1194:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=2)",
 1195:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1196: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1197: 			   ok
 1198:                    end},
 1199:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - (self) two",
 1200:            cmd  => fun(#{mon1 := MRef1,
 1201: 			 mon2 := MRef2} = _State) ->
 1202: 			   Mons = lists:sort([MRef1, MRef2]),
 1203: 			   case lists:sort(socket:which_monitors(self())) of
 1204: 			       Mons ->
 1205: 				   ok;
 1206: 			       SMons ->
 1207: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected (self) monitors: "
 1208: 					       "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1209: 					       "~n   Actual:   ~p",
 1210: 					       [Mons, SMons]),
 1211: 				   {error, unexpected_monitors}
 1212: 			   end
 1213:                    end},
 1214:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - (sock) two",
 1215:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1216: 			 mon1 := MRef1,
 1217: 			 mon2 := MRef2} = _State) ->
 1218: 			   Mons = lists:sort([MRef1, MRef2]),
 1219: 			   case lists:sort(socket:which_monitors(Sock)) of
 1220: 			       Mons ->
 1221: 				   ok;
 1222: 			       SMons ->
 1223: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected (sock) monitors: "
 1224: 					       "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1225: 					       "~n   Actual:   ~p",
 1226: 					       [Mons, SMons]),
 1227: 				   {error, unexpected_monitors}
 1228: 			   end
 1229:                    end},
 1230:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - only us",
 1231:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1232: 			   Self   = self(),
 1233: 			   [Self] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1234: 			   ok
 1235:                    end},
 1236: 
 1237:          %% The actual test
 1238:          #{desc => "order owner to close",
 1239:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1240:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 1241:                            ok
 1242:                    end},
 1243:          #{desc => "await socket down 1",
 1244:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1245: 			 mon1 := MRef} = State) ->
 1246: 			   receive
 1247: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1248: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1249: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1250: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
 1251: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1252: 					       [MRef,
 1253: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
 1254: 						Info]),
 1255: 				   {ok, maps:remove(mon1, State)}
 1256: 			   after 5000 ->
 1257: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1258: 				   {error, timeout}
 1259: 			   end
 1260:                    end},
 1261:          #{desc => "await socket down 2",
 1262:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1263: 			 mon2  := MRef} = State) ->
 1264: 			   receive
 1265: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1266: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1267: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1268: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
 1269: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1270: 					       [MRef,
 1271: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
 1272: 						Info]),
 1273: 				   {ok, maps:remove(mon2, State)}
 1274: 			   after 5000 ->
 1275: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1276: 				   {error, timeout}
 1277: 			   end
 1278:                    end},
 1279:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1280:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1281: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1282: 			   ok
 1283:                    end},
 1284:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1285:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1286: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1287: 			   ok
 1288:                    end},
 1289:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1290:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1291: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1292: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1293: 			   ok
 1294:                    end},
 1295:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - none",
 1296:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1297: 			   [] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1298: 			   ok
 1299:                    end},
 1300: 
 1301:          %% Cleanup
 1302:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1303:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1304:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1305:                            ok
 1306:                    end},
 1307: 
 1308:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1309:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1310:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1311:                                ok ->
 1312:                                    ok;
 1313:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1314:                                    ERROR
 1315:                            end
 1316:                    end},
 1317: 
 1318:          %% *** We are done ***
 1319:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1320:         ],
 1321: 
 1322:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1323:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1324: 
 1325:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1326:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1327:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1328: 
 1329:     i("await evaluator"),
 1330:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1331: 
 1332: 
 1333: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1334: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process then stop the
 1335: %% owner process.
 1336: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1337: 
 1338: monitor_simple_open_and_exit(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1339:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1340:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_exit,
 1341:            fun() ->
 1342: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1343:                                  type     => stream,
 1344:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1345:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_exit(InitState)
 1346:            end).
 1347: 
 1348: 
 1349: mon_simple_open_and_exit(InitState) ->
 1350:     OwnerSeq =
 1351:         [
 1352:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1353:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1354:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1355:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1356:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1357:                    end},
 1358:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1359:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1360:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1361:                            ok
 1362:                    end},
 1363: 
 1364:          %% *** Init part ***
 1365:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1366:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1367:                          type     := Type, 
 1368:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1369:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1370:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1371:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1372:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1373:                                    ERROR
 1374:                            end
 1375:                    end},
 1376:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1377:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1378:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1379:                            ok
 1380:                    end},
 1381: 
 1382:          %% The actual test
 1383:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1384:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1385:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1386:                                ok ->
 1387:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1388:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1389:                                    ERROR
 1390:                            end
 1391:                    end},
 1392: 
 1393:          %% *** We are done ***
 1394:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1395:         ],
 1396: 
 1397:     TesterSeq =
 1398:         [
 1399:          %% *** Init part ***
 1400:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1401:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1402:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1403:                            ok
 1404:                    end},
 1405:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1406:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1407:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1408:                            ok
 1409:                    end},
 1410:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1411:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1412:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1413:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1414:                    end},
 1415:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1416:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1417: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1418: 			   ok
 1419:                    end},
 1420:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1421:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1422: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1423: 			   ok
 1424:                    end},
 1425:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 1426:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1427:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1428: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 1429: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 1430:                    end},
 1431:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 1432:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1433: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1434: 			   ok
 1435:                    end},
 1436:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 1437:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1438: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1439: 			   ok
 1440:                    end},
 1441:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1442:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1443: 			 mon  := MRef} = _State) ->
 1444: 			   [MRef] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1445: 			   [MRef] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1446: 			   ok
 1447:                    end},
 1448:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - only us",
 1449:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1450: 			   Self   = self(),
 1451: 			   [Self] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1452: 			   ok
 1453:                    end},
 1454: 
 1455:          %% The actual test
 1456:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1457:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1458:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1459:                            ok
 1460:                    end},
 1461:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1462:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1463:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1464:                                ok ->
 1465:                                    ok;
 1466:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1467:                                    ERROR
 1468:                            end
 1469:                    end},
 1470: 
 1471:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 1472:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1473: 			 mon  := MRef} = _State) ->
 1474: 			   receive
 1475: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1476: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1477: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1478: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 1479: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1480: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 1481: 				   ok
 1482: 			   after 5000 ->
 1483: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1484: 				   {error, timeout}
 1485: 			   end
 1486:                    end},
 1487:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1488:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1489: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1490: 			   ok
 1491:                    end},
 1492:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1493:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1494: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1495: 			   ok
 1496:                    end},
 1497:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1498:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1499: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1500: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1501: 			   ok
 1502:                    end},
 1503:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - none",
 1504:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1505: 			   [] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1506: 			   ok
 1507:                    end},
 1508: 
 1509:          %% *** We are done ***
 1510:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1511:         ],
 1512: 
 1513:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1514:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1515: 
 1516:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1517:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1518:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1519: 
 1520:     i("await evaluator"),
 1521:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1522: 
 1523: 
 1524: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1525: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process, cancel_montor
 1526: %% (demonitor) and then close socket.
 1527: %% The process that did the monitor shall *not* receive a socket DOWN.
 1528: 
 1529: monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1530:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1531:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close,
 1532:            fun() ->
 1533: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1534:                                  type     => stream,
 1535:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1536:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(InitState)
 1537:            end).
 1538: 
 1539: 
 1540: mon_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(InitState) ->
 1541:     OwnerSeq =
 1542:         [
 1543:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1544:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1545:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1546:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1547:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1548:                    end},
 1549:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1550:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1551:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1552:                            ok
 1553:                    end},
 1554: 
 1555:          %% *** Init part ***
 1556:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1557:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1558:                          type     := Type, 
 1559:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1560:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1561:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1562:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1563:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1564:                                    ERROR
 1565:                            end
 1566:                    end},
 1567:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1568:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1569:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1570:                            ok
 1571:                    end},
 1572: 
 1573:          %% The actual test
 1574:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 1575:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1576:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 1577:                    end},
 1578: 
 1579:          #{desc => "close socket",
 1580:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1581:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1582: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 1583:                    end},
 1584: 
 1585:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1586:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1587:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1588:                                ok ->
 1589:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1590:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1591:                                    ERROR
 1592:                            end
 1593:                    end},
 1594: 
 1595:          %% *** We are done ***
 1596:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1597:         ],
 1598: 
 1599:     TesterSeq =
 1600:         [
 1601:          %% *** Init part ***
 1602:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1603:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1604:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1605:                            ok
 1606:                    end},
 1607:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1608:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1609:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1610:                            ok
 1611:                    end},
 1612:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1613:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1614:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1615:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1616:                    end},
 1617:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1618:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1619: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1620: 			   ok
 1621:                    end},
 1622:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1623:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1624: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1625: 			   ok
 1626:                    end},
 1627:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 1628:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1629:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1630: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 1631: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 1632:                    end},
 1633:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 1634:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1635: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1636: 			   ok
 1637:                    end},
 1638:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 1639:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1640: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1641: 			   ok
 1642:                    end},
 1643: 
 1644:          %% The actual test
 1645:          #{desc => "demonitor socket",
 1646:            cmd  => fun(#{mon := MRef} = State) ->
 1647:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 1648: 			   {ok, maps:remove(mon, State)}
 1649:                    end},
 1650: 
 1651: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1652: 	   cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1653: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1654: 			   ok
 1655: 		   end},
 1656: 	 #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1657: 	   cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1658: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1659: 			   ok
 1660: 		   end},
 1661: 
 1662:          #{desc => "order owner to close",
 1663:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1664:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 1665:                            ok
 1666:                    end},
 1667: 
 1668:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 1669:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1670: 			   receive
 1671: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1672: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("received UNEXPECTED down: "
 1673: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1674: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 1675: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1676: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 1677: 				   {error, unexpected_down}
 1678: 			   after 5000 ->
 1679: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("expected socket down timeout"),
 1680: 				   ok
 1681: 			   end
 1682:                    end},
 1683: 
 1684:          %% Cleanup
 1685:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1686:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1687:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1688:                            ok
 1689:                    end},
 1690: 
 1691:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1692:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1693:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1694:                                ok ->
 1695:                                    ok;
 1696:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1697:                                    ERROR
 1698:                            end
 1699:                    end},
 1700: 
 1701:          %% *** We are done ***
 1702:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1703:         ],
 1704: 
 1705:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1706:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1707: 
 1708:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1709:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1710:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1711: 
 1712:     i("await evaluator"),
 1713:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1714: 
 1715: 
 1716: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1717: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process then close
 1718: %% socket. The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1719: 
 1720: monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1721:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1722:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks,
 1723:            fun() ->
 1724: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1725:                                  type     => stream,
 1726:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1727:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_socks(InitState)
 1728:            end).
 1729: 
 1730: 
 1731: mon_open_and_close_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 1732:     OwnerSeq =
 1733:         [
 1734:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1735:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1736:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1737:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1738:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1739:                    end},
 1740:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1741:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1742:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1743:                            ok
 1744:                    end},
 1745: 
 1746:          %% *** Init part ***
 1747:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 1748:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1749:                          type     := Type, 
 1750:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1751:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1752:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1753:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 1754:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1755:                                    ERROR
 1756:                            end
 1757:                    end},
 1758:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 1759:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1760:                          type     := Type, 
 1761:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1762:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1763:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1764:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 1765:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1766:                                    ERROR
 1767:                            end
 1768:                    end},
 1769:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 1770:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1771:                          type     := Type, 
 1772:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1773:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1774:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1775:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 1776:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1777:                                    ERROR
 1778:                            end
 1779:                    end},
 1780:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 1781:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1782:                          type     := Type, 
 1783:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1784:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1785:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1786:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 1787:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1788:                                    ERROR
 1789:                            end
 1790:                    end},
 1791:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
 1792:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1793:                          type     := Type, 
 1794:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1795:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1796:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1797:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
 1798:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1799:                                    ERROR
 1800:                            end
 1801:                    end},
 1802:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1803:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 1804: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 1805: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 1806: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 1807: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 1808: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 1809: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 1810:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 1811:                            ok
 1812:                    end},
 1813: 
 1814:          %% The actual test
 1815:          #{desc => "await continue (close1)",
 1816:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1817:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close1)
 1818:                    end},
 1819:          #{desc => "close socket 1",
 1820:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock} = State) ->
 1821:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1822: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock1, State)}
 1823:                    end},
 1824:

 1827:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close2)
 1828:                    end},

 1830:            cmd  => fun(#{sock2 := Sock} = State) ->
 1831:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1832: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock2, State)}
 1833:                    end},
 1834: 
 1835:          #{desc => "await continue (close3)",
 1836:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1837:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close3)
 1838:                    end},
 1839:          #{desc => "close socket 3",
 1840:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock} = State) ->
 1841:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1842: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock3, State)}
 1843:                    end},
 1844: 
 1845:          #{desc => "await continue (close4)",
 1846:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1847:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close4)
 1848:                    end},
 1849:          #{desc => "close socket 4",
 1850:            cmd  => fun(#{sock4 := Sock} = State) ->
 1851:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1852: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock4, State)}
 1853:                    end},

 1857:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close5)
 1858:                    end},

 1860:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock} = State) ->
 1861:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1862: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock5, State)}
 1863:                    end},
 1864: 
 1865:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1866:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1867:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1868:                                ok ->
 1869:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1870:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1871:                                    ERROR
 1872:                            end
 1873:                    end},
 1874: 
 1875:          %% *** We are done ***
 1876:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1877:         ],

 1879:     TesterSeq =
 1880:         [
 1881:          %% *** Init part ***

 1883:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1884:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1885:                            ok
 1886:                    end},
 1887:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1888:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1889:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1890:                            ok
 1891:                    end},
 1892:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",

 1895: 			       ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),

 1897: 				       sock2 => Sock2,
 1898: 				       sock3 => Sock3,
 1899: 				       sock4 => Sock4,

 1901:                    end},

 1904: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1905: 			   ok

 1926: 				       "~n   3: ~p"

 1931: 				       mon2 => MRef2,
 1932: 				       mon3 => MRef3,
 1933: 				       mon4 => MRef4,
 1934: 				       mon5 => MRef5}}
 1935:                    end},

 1937:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1938: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1939: 			   ok
 1940:                    end},

 1942:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1943: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1944: 			   ok
 1945:                    end},
 1946: 
 1947:          %% The actual test
 1948:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 1",
 1949:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1950:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close1),
 1951:                            ok
 1952:                    end},
 1953:          #{desc => "await socket 1 down",

 1955: 			 mon1  := MRef} = State) ->
 1956: 			   receive
 1957: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1958: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "

 1963: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
 1964: 						Info]),

 1966: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon1,  State2),
 1967: 				   {ok, State3}
 1968: 			   after 5000 ->
 1969: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1970: 				   {error, timeout}
 1971: 			   end
 1972:                    end},

 2097: 			 mon5  := MRef} = State) ->
 2098: 			   receive
 2099: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2100: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2101: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2102: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2103: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",

 2145:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 2146:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 2147: 
 2148:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 2149:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 2150:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 2151: 
 2152:     i("await evaluator"),
 2153:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
