 5551:                    end},
 5552:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 5553:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5554:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5555:                                ok ->
 5556:                                    {ok, maps:remove(owner, State)};
 5557:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5558:                                    ERROR
 5559:                            end
 5560:                    end},
 5561: 
 5562:          #{desc => "await (client 1) ready",
 5563:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5564:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client1, down)
 5565:                    end},
 5566:          #{desc => "await (client 2) ready",
 5567:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5568:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client2, down)
 5569:                    end},
 5570:          #{desc => "await (client 3) ready",
 5571:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5572:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client3, down)
 5573:                    end},
 5574:          #{desc => "await (client 4) ready",
 5575:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5576:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client4, down)
 5577:                    end},
 5578:          #{desc => "await (client 5) ready",
 5579:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5580:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client5, down)
 5581:                    end},
 5582: 
 5583: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 5584:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 5585: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 5586: 			   ok
 5587:                    end},
 5588: 
 5589: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5590: 
 5591:          %% Cleanup
 5592:          #{desc => "order (client 1) terminate",
 5593:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5594:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5595:                            ok
 5596:                    end},
 5597:          #{desc => "await (client 1) termination",
 5598:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = State) ->
 5599:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5600:                                ok ->
 5601:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client1, State)};
 5602:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5603:                                    ERROR
 5604:                            end
 5605:                    end},
 5606: 
 5607:          #{desc => "order (client 2) terminate",
 5608:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5609:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5610:                            ok
 5611:                    end},
 5612:          #{desc => "await (client 2) termination",
 5613:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = State) ->
 5614:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5615:                                ok ->
 5616:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client2, State)};
 5617:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5618:                                    ERROR
 5619:                            end
 5620:                    end},
 5621: 
 5622:          #{desc => "order (client 3) terminate",
 5623:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5624:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5625:                            ok
 5626:                    end},
 5627:          #{desc => "await (client 3) termination",
 5628:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = State) ->
 5629:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5630:                                ok ->
 5631:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client3, State)};
 5632:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5633:                                    ERROR
 5634:                            end
 5635:                    end},
 5636: 
 5637:          #{desc => "order (client 4) terminate",
 5638:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5639:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5640:                            ok
 5641:                    end},
 5642:          #{desc => "await (client 4) termination",
 5643:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = State) ->
 5644:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5645:                                ok ->
 5646:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client4, State)};
 5647:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5648:                                    ERROR
 5649:                            end
 5650:                    end},
 5651: 
 5652:          #{desc => "order (client 5) terminate",
 5653:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5654:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5655:                            ok
 5656:                    end},
 5657:          #{desc => "await (client 5) termination",
 5658:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = State) ->
 5659:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5660:                                ok ->
 5661:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client5, State)};
 5662:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5663:                                    ERROR
 5664:                            end
 5665:                    end},
 5666: 
 5667:          %% *** We are done ***
 5668:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5669:         ],
 5670: 
 5671:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 5672:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 5673: 
 5674:     i("start client 1 evaluator"),
 5675:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5676: 
 5677:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),
 5678:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5679: 
 5680:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),
 5681:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5682: 
 5683:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),
 5684:     Client4 = ?SEV_START("client-4", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5685: 
 5686:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 5687:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5688: 
 5689:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 5690:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 5691: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 5692: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 5693: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 5694: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 5695: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 5696:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 5697: 
 5698:     i("await evaluator"),
 5699:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 5700: 
 5701: 
 5702: 
 5703: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5704: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 5705: %% different processes, then exit the owner.
 5706: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 5707: %% each socket.
 5708: 
 5709: monitor_closed_socket(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 5710:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
 5711:     tc_try(monitor_closed_socket,
 5712:            fun() ->
 5713: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 5714:                                  type     => stream,
 5715:                                  protocol => tcp},
 5716:                    ok = mon_closed_socket(InitState)
 5717:            end).
 5718: 
 5719: 
 5720: mon_closed_socket(InitState) ->
 5721:     OwnerSeq =
 5722:         [
 5723:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 5724:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 5725:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 5726:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 5727:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 5728:                    end},
 5729:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 5730:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5731:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 5732:                            ok
 5733:                    end},
 5734: 
 5735:          %% *** Init part ***
 5736:          #{desc => "create socket",
 5737:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 5738:                          type     := Type, 
 5739:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 5740:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 5741:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 5742:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 5743:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5744:                                    ERROR
 5745:                            end
 5746:                    end},
 5747:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 5748:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 5749: 			 sock   := Sock} = State) ->
 5750:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 5751:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 5752:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 5753:                    end},
 5754: 
 5755:          %% The actual test
 5756:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 5757:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5758:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 5759:                                ok ->
 5760:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 5761:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5762:                                    ERROR
 5763:                            end
 5764:                    end},
 5765: 
 5766:          %% *** We are done ***
 5767:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5768:         ],
 5769: 
 5770: 
 5771:     ClientSeq =
 5772:         [
 5773:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 5774:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 5775:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 5776:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 5777:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 5778:                    end},
 5779:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 5780:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5781:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 5782:                            ok
 5783:                    end},
 5784: 
 5785:          %% *** Init part ***
 5786:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 5787:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5788:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 5789:                            ok
 5790:                    end},
 5791:          #{desc => "await continue (socket)",
 5792:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5793:                            {ok, Sock} =
 5794:                                ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, socket),
 5795: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Socket: "
 5796: 				       "~n      ~p", [Sock]),
 5797: 			   {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 5798:                    end},
 5799: 
 5800: 
 5801:          %% The actual test
 5802:          #{desc => "await continue (monitor)",
 5803:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5804:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, monitor)
 5805:                    end},
 5806: 
 5807:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 5808:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 5809:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 5810: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors: "
 5811: 				       "~n      ~p", [MRef]),
 5812: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 5813:                    end},
 5814:          
 5815:          #{desc => "announce ready (monitor)",
 5816:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5817:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, monitor),
 5818:                            ok
 5819:                    end},
 5820: 
 5821:          #{desc => "await continue (down)",
 5822:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5823:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, down)
 5824:                    end},
 5825: 
 5826:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 5827:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 5828: 			 mon  := MRef} = State) ->
 5829: 			   receive
 5830: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 5831: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 5832: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 5833: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 5834: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 5835: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 5836: 				   State2 = maps:remove(mon,  State),
 5837: 				   State3 = maps:remove(sock, State2),
 5838: 				   {ok, State3}
 5839: 			   after 1000 ->
 5840: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 5841: 				   {error, timeout}
 5842: 			   end
 5843:                    end},
 5844: 
 5845:          #{desc => "announce ready (down)",
 5846:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5847:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, down),
 5848:                            ok
 5849:                    end},
 5850: 
 5851: 
 5852:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 5853:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5854:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 5855:                                ok ->
 5856:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 5857:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5858:                                    ERROR
 5859:                            end
 5860:                    end},
 5861: 
 5862:          %% *** We are done ***
 5863:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5864:         ],
 5865: 
 5866:     TesterSeq =
 5867:         [
 5868:          %% *** Init part ***
 5869:          #{desc => "monitor 'owner'",
 5870:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 5871:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 5872:                            ok
 5873:                    end},
 5874:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 5875:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 5876:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 5877:                            ok
 5878:                    end},
 5879:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 5880:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5881:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 5882:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 5883:                    end},
 5884: 
 5885:          #{desc => "monitor client",
 5886:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5887:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 5888:                            ok
 5889:                    end},
 5890:          #{desc => "order client start",
 5891:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5892:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 5893:                            ok
 5894:                    end},
 5895:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5896:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5897:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
 5898:                    end},
 5899:          #{desc => "send socket to client",
 5900:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid,
 5901: 			 sock   := Sock} = _State) ->
 5902:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, socket, Sock),
 5903:                            ok
 5904:                    end},
 5905: 
 5906:          %% The actual test
 5907:          %% There is no way we can actually know that the "system"
 5908:          %% does not create *any* sockets...
 5909:          #{desc => "order client to monitor",
 5910:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5911:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, monitor),
 5912:                            ok
 5913:                    end},
 5914:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5915:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5916:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, monitor)
 5917:                    end},
 5918: 
 5919:          #{desc => "order client to await down",
 5920:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5921:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, down),
 5922:                            ok
 5923:                    end},
 5924: 
 5925: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5926: 
 5927:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 5928:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 5929:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5930:                            ok
 5931:                    end},
 5932:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 5933:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5934:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5935:                                ok ->
 5936:                                    {ok, maps:remove(owner, State)};
 5937:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5938:                                    ERROR
 5939:                            end
 5940:                    end},
 5941: 
 5942:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5943:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5944:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, down)
 5945:                    end},
 5946: 
 5947: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 5948:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 5949: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 5950: 			   ok
 5951:                    end},
 5952: 
 5953: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5954: 
 5955:          %% Cleanup
 5956:          #{desc => "order client terminate",
 5957:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5958:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5959:                            ok
 5960:                    end},
 5961:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 5962:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
 5963:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5964:                                ok ->
 5965:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client, State)};
 5966:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5967:                                    ERROR
 5968:                            end
 5969:                    end},
 5970: 
 5971:          %% *** We are done ***
 5972:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5973:         ],
 5974: 
 5975:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 5976:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 5977: 
 5978:     i("start client  evaluator"),
 5979:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5980: 
 5981:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 5982:     TesterInitState = #{owner  => Owner#ev.pid,
 5983: 			client => Client#ev.pid},
 5984:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 5985: 
 5986:     i("await evaluator"),
 5987:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Client, Tester]).
 5988: 
 5989: 
 5990: 
 5991: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5992: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5993: %%                                                                     %%
 5994: %%                         SOCKET CLOSURE                              %%
 5995: %%                                                                     %%
 5996: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5997: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5998: 
 5999: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6000: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6001: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6002: %% calling the close function). For a IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
 6003: 
 6004: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6005:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6006:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp4,
 6007:            fun() ->
 6008:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6009:                                  type     => stream,
 6010:                                  protocol => tcp},
 6011:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6012:            end).
 6013: 
 6014: 
 6015: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6016: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6017: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6018: %% calling the close function). For a IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
 6019: 
 6020: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6021:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6022:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6,
 6023:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6024:            fun() ->
 6025:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6026:                                  type     => stream,
 6027:                                  protocol => tcp},
 6028:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6029:            end).
 6030: 
 6031: 
 6032: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6033: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6034: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6035: %% calling the close function). For a Unix Domain (stream) socket (TCP).
 6036: 
 6037: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6038:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6039:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcpL,
 6040:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 6041:            fun() ->
 6042:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6043:                                  type     => stream,
 6044:                                  protocol => default},
 6045:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6046:            end).
 6047: 
 6048: 
 6049: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6050: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6051: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6052: %% calling the close function). For a IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
 6053: 
 6054: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6055:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6056:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp4,
 6057:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6058:            fun() ->
 6059:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6060:                                  type     => dgram,
 6061:                                  protocol => udp},
 6062:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6063:            end).
 6064: 
 6065: 
 6066: 
 6067: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6068: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6069: %% (removed) when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6070: %% calling the close function). For a IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
 6071: 
 6072: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6073:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6074:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp6,
 6075:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6076:            fun() ->
 6077:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6078:                                  type     => dgram,
 6079:                                  protocol => udp},
 6080:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6081:            end).
 6082: 
 6083: 
 6084: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6085: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6086: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6087: %% calling the close function). For a Unix Domain (dgram) socket (UDP).
 6088: 
 6089: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6090:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6091:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL,
 6092:            fun() ->
 6093: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
 6094: 		   is_not_windows()
 6095: 	   end,
 6096:            fun() ->
 6097:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6098:                                  type     => dgram,
 6099:                                  protocol => default},
 6100:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6101:            end).
 6102: 
 6103: 
 6104: 
 6105: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6106: 
 6107: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState) ->
 6108:     OwnerSeq =
 6109:         [
 6110:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6111:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6112:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6113:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6114:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6115:                    end},
 6116:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6117:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6118:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6119:                            ok
 6120:                    end},
 6121: 
 6122:          %% *** Init part ***
 6123:          #{desc => "create socket",
 6124:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 6125:                          type     := Type, 
 6126:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 6127:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 6128:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6129:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 6130:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6131:                                    ERROR
 6132:                            end
 6133:                    end},
 6134:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6135:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6136:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 6137:                            ok
 6138:                    end},
 6139: 
 6140:          %% *** The actual test ***
 6141:          %% We *intentionally* leave the socket "as is", no explicit close
 6142:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 6143:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6144:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6145:                                ok ->
 6146:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6147:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6148:                                    ERROR
 6149:                            end
 6150:                    end},
 6151: 
 6152:          %% *** We are done ***
 6153:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6154:         ],
 6155: 
 6156:     TesterSeq =
 6157:         [
 6158:          %% *** Init part ***
 6159:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 6160:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 6161:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 6162:                            ok
 6163:                    end},
 6164:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 6165:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6166:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6167:                            ok
 6168:                    end},
 6169:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 6170:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 6171:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 6172:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 6173:                    end},
 6174:          #{desc => "verify owner as controlling-process",
 6175:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6176:                            case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, controlling_process) of
 6177:                                {ok, Pid} ->
 6178:                                    ok;
 6179:                                {ok, Other} ->
 6180:                                    {error, {unexpected_owner, Other}};
 6181:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6182:                                    ERROR
 6183:                            end
 6184:                    end},
 6185:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 6186:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6187:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6188:                            ok
 6189:                    end},
 6190:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 6191:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6192:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6193:                                ok ->
 6194:                                    ok;
 6195:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6196:                                    ERROR
 6197:                            end
 6198:                    end},
 6199: 
 6200:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(5)),
 6201: 
 6202:          %% The reason we get closed, is that as long as there is a ref to 
 6203:          %% the resource (socket), then it will not be garbage collected.
 6204:          %% Note that its still a race that the nif has processed that the
 6205:          %% "controlling process" has terminated. There really is no 
 6206:          %% proper timeout for this, but the 5 seconds "should" be enough...
 6207:          %% We should really have some way to subscribe to socket events...
 6208:          #{desc => "verify no socket (closed)",
 6209:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6210:                            case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, controlling_process) of
 6211:                                {ok, OtherPid} ->
 6212:                                    {error, {unexpected_success, Pid, OtherPid}};
 6213:                                {error, closed} ->
 6214:                                    ok;
 6215:                                {error, Reason} ->
 6216:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected failure: ~p", [Reason]),
 6217:                                    {error, {unexpected_failure, Reason}}
 6218:                            end
 6219:                    end},
 6220: 
 6221:          %% *** We are done ***
 6222:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6223:         ],
 6224: 
 6225:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 6226:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 6227: 
 6228:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 6229:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 6230:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 6231: 
 6232:     i("await evaluator"),
 6233:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 6234: 
 6235: 
 6236: 
 6237: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6238: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6239: %% locally closed while a process is calling the recv function.
 6240: %% Socket is IPv4.
 6241: %% 
 6242: %% <KOLLA>
 6243: %% 
 6244: %% We should really have a similar test cases for when the controlling
 6245: %% process exits and there are other processes in recv, accept, and 
 6246: %% all the other functions.
 6247: %% 
 6248: %% </KOLLA>
 6249: 
 6250: sc_lc_recv_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6251:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6252:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcp4,
 6253:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6254:            fun() ->
 6255:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6256:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6257:                                  protocol => tcp,
 6258:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6259:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6260:            end).
 6261: 
 6262: 
 6263: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6264: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6265: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6266: %% Socket is IPv6.
 6267: 
 6268: sc_lc_recv_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6269:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6270:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcp6,
 6271:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6272:            fun() ->
 6273:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6274:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6275:                                  protocol => tcp,
 6276:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6277:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6278:            end).
 6279: 
 6280: 
 6281: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6282: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6283: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6284: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 6285: 
 6286: sc_lc_recv_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6287:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6288:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcpL,
 6289:            fun() ->
 6290: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket()
 6291: 	   end,
 6292:            fun() ->
 6293:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6294:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6295:                                  protocol => default,
 6296:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6297:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6298:            end).
 6299: 
 6300: 
 6301: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6302: 
 6303: sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 6304:     %% This (acceptor) is the server that accepts connections.
 6305:     %% But it is also suppose to close the connection socket, 
 6306:     %% and trigger the read failure (=closed) for the handler process.
 6307:     AcceptorSeq =
 6308:         [
 6309:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6310:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6311:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6312:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6313:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6314:                    end},
 6315:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6316:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6317:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6318:                            ok
 6319:                    end},
 6320: 
 6321:          %% *** Init part ***
 6322:          #{desc => "which local address",
 6323:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 6324:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 6325:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
 6326:                    end},
 6327:          #{desc => "create (listen) socket",
 6328:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 6329:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 6330:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 6331:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6332:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
 6333:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6334:                                    ERROR
 6335:                            end
 6336:                    end},
 6337:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 6338:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 6339:                          lsock  := LSock,
 6340:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
 6341:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("bind to LSA: "
 6342:                                        "~n   ~p", [LSA]),
 6343:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
 6344:                                ok ->
 6345:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 6346:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6347:                                    ERROR
 6348:                            end;
 6349:                       (#{lsock := LSock,
 6350:                          lsa   := LSA} = State) ->
 6351:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 6352:                                ok ->
 6353:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 6354:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
 6355:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 6356:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6357:                                    ERROR
 6358:                            end
 6359:                    end},
 6360:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 6361:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 6362:                            socket:listen(LSock)
 6363:                    end},
 6364:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6365:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 6366:                          tester := Tester,
 6367:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}}) ->
 6368:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
 6369:                            ok;
 6370:                       (#{tester := Tester, lport := Port}) ->
 6371:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
 6372:                            ok
 6373:                    end},
 6374:                            
 6375:          %% The actual test
 6376:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 6377:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6378:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept) of
 6379:                                {ok, {H1, H2, H3}} ->
 6380:                                    {ok, State#{handler1 => H1,
 6381:                                                handler2 => H2,
 6382:                                                handler3 => H3}};
 6383:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6384:                                    ERROR
 6385:                            end
 6386:                    end},
 6387:          #{desc => "await accept",
 6388:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
 6389:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 6390:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6391:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("connection accepted: "
 6392:                                                "~n   ~p", [socket:sockname(Sock)]),
 6393:                                    {ok, State#{csock => Sock}};
 6394:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6395:                                    ERROR
 6396:                            end
 6397:                    end},
 6398:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
 6399:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6400:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
 6401:                            ok
 6402:                    end},
 6403:          #{desc => "transfer connection to handler 1",
 6404:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Handler, csock := Sock}) ->
 6405:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, transfer, Sock),
 6406:                            ok
 6407:                    end},
 6408:          #{desc => "transfer connection to handler 2",
 6409:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Handler, csock := Sock}) ->
 6410:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, transfer, Sock),
 6411:                            ok
 6412:                    end},
 6413:          #{desc => "transfer connection to handler 3",
 6414:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Handler, csock := Sock}) ->
 6415:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, transfer, Sock),
 6416:                            ok
 6417:                    end},
 6418:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 6419:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6420:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close),
 6421:                            ok
 6422:                    end},
 6423:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
 6424:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = State) ->
 6425:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 6426:                                ok ->
 6427:                                    {ok, maps:remove(csock, State)};
 6428:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6429:                                    ERROR
 6430:                            end
 6431:                    end},
 6432:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 6433:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6434:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 6435:                            ok
 6436:                    end},
 6437: 
 6438:          %% *** Terminate ***
 6439:          #{desc => "await terminate",
 6440:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6441:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6442:                                ok ->
 6443:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6444:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6445:                                    ERROR
 6446:                            end
 6447:                    end},
 6448:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
 6449:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 6450:                          lsock  := Sock,
 6451:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 6452:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 6453:                            State1 =
 6454:                                unlink_path(Path,
 6455:                                            fun() ->maps:remove(lsa, State) end,
 6456:                                            fun() -> State end),
 6457:                            State2 = maps:remove(lsock, State1),
 6458:                            State3 = maps:remove(lport, State2),
 6459:                            {ok, State3};
 6460:                       (#{lsock := Sock} = State) ->
 6461:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 6462:                                ok ->
 6463:                                    State1 = maps:remove(lsock, State),
 6464:                                    State2 = maps:remove(lport, State1),
 6465:                                    {ok, State2};
 6466:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6467:                                    ERROR
 6468:                            end
 6469:                    end},
 6470: 
 6471:          %% *** We are done ***
 6472:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6473:         ],
 6474: 
 6475:     %% The point of this is to perform the recv for which
 6476:     %% we are testing the response.
 6477:     HandlerSeq =
 6478:         [
 6479:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6480:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6481:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6482:                            {Tester, Acceptor} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6483:                            {ok, State#{tester  => Tester, 
 6484:                                       acceptor => Acceptor}}
 6485:                    end},
 6486:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6487:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6488:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6489:                            ok
 6490:                    end},
 6491:          #{desc => "monitor acceptor",
 6492:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor} = _State) ->
 6493:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Acceptor),
 6494:                            ok
 6495:                    end},
 6496:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6497:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6498:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 6499:                            ok
 6500:                    end},
 6501: 
 6502:          %% The actual test
 6503:          #{desc => "await continue (transfer)",
 6504:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
 6505:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Pid, acceptor, transfer) of
 6506:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6507:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 6508:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6509:                                    ERROR
 6510:                            end
 6511:                    end},
 6512:          #{desc => "announce ready (transfer)",
 6513:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6514:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, transfer),
 6515:                            ok
 6516:                    end},
 6517:          #{desc => "attempt recv (=> closed)",
 6518:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 6519:                            %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
 6520:                            case Recv(Sock) of
 6521:                                {ok, _Data} ->
 6522:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected data received"),
 6523:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 6524:                                {error, closed} ->
 6525:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected 'closed' "
 6526:                                                "result"),
 6527:                                    State1 = maps:remove(sock, State),
 6528:                                    {ok, State1};
 6529:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 6530:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected read failure: "
 6531:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 6532:                                    ERROR
 6533:                            end
 6534:                    end},
 6535:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed)",
 6536:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6537:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
 6538:                            ok
 6539:                    end},
 6540: 
 6541:          %% *** Terminate ***
 6542:          #{desc => "await terminate",
 6543:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6544:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6545:                                ok ->
 6546:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6547:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6548:                                    ERROR
 6549:                            end
 6550:                    end},
 6551: 
 6552: 
 6553:          %% *** We are done ***
 6554:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6555:         ],
 6556: 
 6557:     %% The point of this is basically just to create the connection.
 6558:     ClientSeq =
 6559:         [
 6560:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6561:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6562:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6563:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6564:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6565:                    end},
 6566:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6567:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6568:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6569:                            ok
 6570:                    end},
 6571: 
 6572:          %% *** Init part ***
 6573:          #{desc => "which local address",
 6574:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 6575:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 6576:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 6577:                    end},
 6578:          #{desc => "create socket",
 6579:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 6580:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 6581:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 6582:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6583:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 6584:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6585:                                    ERROR
 6586:                            end
 6587:                    end},
 6588:          #{desc => "bind socket to local address",
 6589:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
 6590:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("bind to LSA: "
 6591:                                        "~n   ~p", [LSA]),
 6592:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
 6593:                                ok ->
 6594:                                    ok;
 6595:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6596:                                    ERROR
 6597:                            end
 6598:                    end},
 6599:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6600:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6601:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 6602:                            ok
 6603:                    end},
 6604: 
 6605:          %% The actual test
 6606:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
 6607:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain,
 6608:                          tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6609:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect) of
 6610:                                {ok, ServerPath} ->
 6611:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Server Path: "
 6612:                                                "~n   ~s", [ServerPath]),
 6613:                                    ServerSA = #{family => Domain,
 6614:                                                 path   => ServerPath},
 6615:                                    {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}};
 6616:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6617:                                    ERROR
 6618:                            end;
 6619:                       (#{tester := Tester, local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 6620:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect) of
 6621:                                {ok, Port} ->
 6622:                                    ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
 6623:                                    {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}};
 6624:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6625:                                    ERROR
 6626:                            end
 6627:                    end},
 6628:          #{desc => "connect to server",
 6629:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, server_sa := ServerSA}) ->
 6630:                            socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA)
 6631:                    end},
 6632:          #{desc => "announce ready (connect)",
 6633:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6634:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
 6635:                            ok
 6636:                    end},
 6637: 
 6638:          %% *** Terminate ***
 6639:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 6640:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6641:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6642:                                ok ->
 6643:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6644:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6645:                                    ERROR
 6646:                            end                           
 6647:                    end},
 6648:          #{desc => "close socket",
 6649:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 6650:                          sock     := Sock,
 6651:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 6652:                            sock_close(Sock),
 6653:                            State1 =
 6654:                                unlink_path(Path,
 6655:                                            fun() ->
 6656:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
 6657:                                            end,
 6658:                                            fun() -> State end),
 6659:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
 6660:                        (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 6661:                            sock_close(Sock),
 6662:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 6663:                    end},
 6664: 
 6665:          %% *** We are done ***
 6666:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6667:         ],
 6668: 
 6669:     TesterSeq =
 6670:         [
 6671:          %% *** Init part ***
 6672:          #{desc => "monitor acceptor",
 6673:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6674:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6675:                            ok
 6676:                    end},
 6677:          #{desc => "monitor handler 1",
 6678:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6679:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6680:                            ok
 6681:                    end},
 6682:          #{desc => "monitor handler 2",
 6683:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6684:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6685:                            ok
 6686:                    end},
 6687:          #{desc => "monitor handler 3",
 6688:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6689:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6690:                            ok
 6691:                    end},
 6692:          #{desc => "monitor client",
 6693:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6694:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6695:                            ok
 6696:                    end},
 6697: 
 6698:          %% Start the acceptor
 6699:          #{desc => "order acceptor start",
 6700:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6701:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6702:                            ok
 6703:                    end},
 6704:          #{desc => "await acceptor ready (init)",
 6705:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
 6706:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, acceptor, init) of
 6707:                                {ok, PortOrPath} ->
 6708:                                    {ok, State#{server_info => PortOrPath}};
 6709:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6710:                                    ERROR
 6711:                            end
 6712:                    end},
 6713: 
 6714:          %% Start the handler(s)
 6715:          #{desc => "order handler 1 start",
 6716:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor, handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6717:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Acceptor),
 6718:                            ok
 6719:                    end},
 6720:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (init)",
 6721:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6722:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler1, init)
 6723:                    end},
 6724:          #{desc => "order handler 2 start",
 6725:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor, handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6726:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Acceptor),
 6727:                            ok
 6728:                    end},
 6729:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (init)",
 6730:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6731:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler2, init)
 6732:                    end},
 6733:          #{desc => "order handler 3 start",
 6734:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor, handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6735:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Acceptor),
 6736:                            ok
 6737:                    end},
 6738:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (init)",
 6739:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6740:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler3, init)
 6741:                    end},
 6742: 
 6743:          %% Start the client
 6744:          #{desc => "order client start",
 6745:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6746:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6747:                            ok
 6748:                    end},
 6749:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
 6750:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6751:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
 6752:                    end},
 6753: 
 6754:          %% The actual test
 6755:          #{desc => "order acceptor to continue (accept)",
 6756:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid, 
 6757:                          handler1 := H1, 
 6758:                          handler2 := H2, 
 6759:                          handler3 := H3} = _State) ->
 6760:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept, {H1, H2, H3}),
 6761:                            ok
 6762:                    end},
 6763:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 6764:          #{desc => "order client to continue (connect)",
 6765:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid, server_info := Info} = _State) ->
 6766:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect, Info),
 6767:                            ok
 6768:                    end},
 6769:          #{desc => "await acceptor ready (accept)",
 6770:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6771:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, acceptor, accept)
 6772:                    end},
 6773:          #{desc => "await client ready (connect)",
 6774:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6775:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, connect)
 6776:                    end},
 6777:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (transfer)",
 6778:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6779:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler1, transfer)
 6780:                    end},
 6781:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (transfer)",
 6782:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6783:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler2, transfer)
 6784:                    end},
 6785:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (transfer)",
 6786:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6787:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler3, transfer)
 6788:                    end},
 6789:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 6790:          #{desc => "order acceptor to continue (close connection socket)",
 6791:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6792:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 6793:                            ok
 6794:                    end},
 6795:          #{desc => "await acceptor ready (close)",
 6796:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6797:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, acceptor, close)
 6798:                    end},
 6799:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (recv closed)",
 6800:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6801:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler1, recv_closed)
 6802:                    end},
 6803:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (recv closed)",
 6804:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6805:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler2, recv_closed)
 6806:                    end},
 6807:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (recv closed)",
 6808:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6809:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler3, recv_closed)
 6810:                    end},
 6811: 
 6812:          %% Terminations
 6813:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
 6814:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6815:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6816:                            ok
 6817:                    end},
 6818:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 6819:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
 6820:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6821:                                ok ->
 6822:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client, State)};
 6823:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6824:                                    ERROR
 6825:                            end
 6826:                    end},
 6827:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to terminate",
 6828:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6829:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6830:                            ok
 6831:                    end},
 6832:          #{desc => "await handler 1 termination",
 6833:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = State) ->
 6834:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6835:                                ok ->
 6836:                                    {ok, maps:remove(handler1, State)};
 6837:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6838:                                    ERROR
 6839:                            end
 6840:                    end},
 6841:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to terminate",
 6842:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6843:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6844:                            ok
 6845:                    end},
 6846:          #{desc => "await handler 2 termination",
 6847:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = State) ->
 6848:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6849:                                ok ->
 6850:                                    {ok, maps:remove(handler2, State)};
 6851:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6852:                                    ERROR
 6853:                            end
 6854:                    end},
 6855:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to terminate",
 6856:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6857:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6858:                            ok
 6859:                    end},
 6860:          #{desc => "await handler 3 termination",
 6861:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = State) ->
 6862:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6863:                                ok ->
 6864:                                    {ok, maps:remove(handler3, State)};
 6865:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6866:                                    ERROR
 6867:                            end
 6868:                    end},
 6869:          #{desc => "order acceptor to terminate",
 6870:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6871:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6872:                            ok
 6873:                    end},
 6874:          #{desc => "await acceptor termination",
 6875:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
 6876:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6877:                                ok ->
 6878:                                    {ok, maps:remove(acceptor, State)};
 6879:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6880:                                    ERROR
 6881:                            end
 6882:                    end},
 6883: 
 6884: 
 6885:          %% *** We are done ***
 6886:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6887:         ],
 6888: 
 6889:     i("start acceptor evaluator"),
 6890:     AccInitState = InitState,
 6891:     Acceptor = ?SEV_START("acceptor", AcceptorSeq, AccInitState),
 6892: 
 6893:     i("start handler 1 evaluator"),
 6894:     HandlerInitState = #{recv => maps:get(recv, InitState)},
 6895:     Handler1 = ?SEV_START("handler-1", HandlerSeq, HandlerInitState),
 6896: 
 6897:     i("start handler 2 evaluator"),
 6898:     Handler2 = ?SEV_START("handler-2", HandlerSeq, HandlerInitState),
 6899: 
 6900:     i("start handler 3 evaluator"),
 6901:     Handler3 = ?SEV_START("handler-3", HandlerSeq, HandlerInitState),
 6902: 
 6903:     i("start client evaluator"),
 6904:     ClientInitState = InitState,
 6905:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 6906: 
 6907:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 6908:     TesterInitState = #{acceptor => Acceptor#ev.pid,
 6909:                         handler1 => Handler1#ev.pid,
 6910:                         handler2 => Handler2#ev.pid,
 6911:                         handler3 => Handler3#ev.pid,
 6912:                         client   => Client#ev.pid},
 6913:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 6914: 
 6915:     i("await evaluator"),
 6916:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Acceptor, 
 6917:                             Handler1, Handler2, Handler3, 
 6918:                             Client, Tester]).
 6919: 
 6920: 
 6921: 
 6922: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6923: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6924: %% locally closed while a process is calling the recvfrom function.
 6925: %% Socket is IPv4.
 6926: %% 
 6927: 
 6928: sc_lc_recvfrom_response_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6929:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6930:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 6931:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6932:            fun() ->
 6933:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) ->
 6934:                                        socket:recvfrom(Sock, [], To)
 6935:                                end,
 6936:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6937:                                  protocol => udp,
 6938:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6939:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
 6940:            end).
 6941: 
 6942: 
 6943: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6944: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6945: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6946: %% Socket is IPv6.
 6947: 
 6948: sc_lc_recvfrom_response_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6949:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6950:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 6951:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6952:            fun() ->
 6953:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) ->
 6954:                                        socket:recvfrom(Sock, [], To)
 6955:                                end,
 6956:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6957:                                  protocol => udp,
 6958:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6959:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
 6960:            end).
 6961: 
 6962: 
 6963: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6964: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6965: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6966: %% Socket is Unix Domainm (dgram) socket.
 6967: 
 6968: sc_lc_recvfrom_response_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6969:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6970:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 6971:            fun() ->
 6972: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
 6973: 		   is_not_windows()
 6974: 	   end,
 6975:            fun() ->
 6976:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) ->
 6977:                                        socket:recvfrom(Sock, [], To)
 6978:                                end,
 6979:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6980:                                  protocol => default,
 6981:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6982:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
 6983:            end).
 6984: 
 6985: 
 6986: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6987: 
 6988: sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState) ->
 6989:     PrimServerSeq =
 6990:         [
 6991:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6992:          #{desc => "await start",
 6993:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6994:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6995:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6996:                    end},
 6997:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6998:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6999:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7000:                            ok
 7001:                    end},
 7002: 
 7003:          %% *** Init part ***
 7004:          #{desc => "local address",
 7005:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 7006:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 7007:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 7008:                    end},
 7009:          #{desc => "open socket",
 7010:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 7011:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
 7012:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 7013:                    end},
 7014:          #{desc => "bind socket",
 7015:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, local_sa := LSA}) ->
 7016:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
 7017:                                ok ->
 7018:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
 7019:                                    ok;
 7020:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 7021:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
 7022:                                    ERROR
 7023:                            end
 7024:                    end},
 7025:          #{desc => "socket name",
 7026:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7027:                            case socket:sockname(Sock) of
 7028:                                {ok, SA} ->
 7029:                                    {ok, State#{sa => SA}};
 7030:                                {error, eafnosupport = Reason} ->
 7031:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed get socket name: "
 7032:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 7033:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 7034:                                    {skip, Reason};
 7035:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 7036:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket name: "
 7037:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 7038:                                    ERROR
 7039:                            end
 7040:                    end},
 7041:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7042:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock}) ->
 7043:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 7044:                            ok
 7045:                    end},
 7046: 
 7047:          %% The actual test
 7048:          #{desc => "await continue (recv, with timeout)",
 7049:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7050:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv) of
 7051:                                {ok, Timeout} ->
 7052:                                    {ok, State#{timeout => Timeout}};
 7053:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7054:                                    ERROR
 7055:                            end
 7056:                    end},
 7057:          #{desc => "receive, with timeout",
 7058:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv, timeout := Timeout}) ->
 7059:                            case Recv(Sock, Timeout) of
 7060:                                {error, timeout} ->
 7061:                                    ok;
 7062:                                {ok, _} ->
 7063:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7064:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7065:                                    ERROR
 7066:                            end
 7067:                    end},
 7068:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv, with timeout)",
 7069:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7070:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv),
 7071:                            ok
 7072:                    end},
 7073:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 7074:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7075:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 7076:                    end},
 7077:          #{desc => "close socket",
 7078:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 7079:                          sock     := Sock,
 7080:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 7081:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 7082:                            State1 =
 7083:                                unlink_path(Path,
 7084:                                            fun() ->
 7085:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
 7086:                                            end,
 7087:                                            fun() -> State end),
 7088:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
 7089:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7090:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7091:                                ok ->
 7092:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7093:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7094:                                    ERROR
 7095:                            end
 7096:                    end},
 7097:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 7098:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7099:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 7100:                            ok
 7101:                    end},
 7102: 
 7103:          %% Termination
 7104:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 7105:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7106:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, terminate) of
 7107:                                ok ->
 7108:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7109:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7110:                                    ERROR
 7111:                            end
 7112:                    end},
 7113: 
 7114:          %% *** We are done ***
 7115:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7116:         ],
 7117: 
 7118:     SecServerSeq =
 7119:         [
 7120:          %% *** Init part ***
 7121:          #{desc => "await start",
 7122:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7123:                            {Tester, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7124:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, sock => Sock}}
 7125:                    end},
 7126:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7127:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7128:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7129:                            ok
 7130:                    end},
 7131:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7132:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7133:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 7134:                            ok
 7135:                    end},
 7136: 
 7137:          %% The actual test
 7138:          #{desc => "await continue (recv)",
 7139:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7140:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv)
 7141:                            
 7142:                    end},
 7143:          #{desc => "receive",
 7144:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 7145:                            case Recv(Sock, infinity) of
 7146:                                {error, closed} ->
 7147:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7148:                                {ok, _} ->
 7149:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7150:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7151:                                    ERROR
 7152:                            end
 7153:                    end},
 7154:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed)",
 7155:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7156:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
 7157:                            ok
 7158:                    end},
 7159: 
 7160:          %% Termination
 7161:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 7162:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7163:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7164:                                ok ->
 7165:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7166:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7167:                                    ERROR
 7168:                            end
 7169:                    end},
 7170: 
 7171:          %% *** We are done ***
 7172:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7173:         ],
 7174: 
 7175: 
 7176:     TesterSeq =
 7177:         [
 7178:          %% *** Init part ***
 7179:          #{desc => "monitor primary server",
 7180:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7181:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7182:                            ok
 7183:                    end},
 7184:          #{desc => "monitor secondary server 1",
 7185:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7186:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7187:                            ok
 7188:                    end},
 7189:          #{desc => "monitor secondary server 2",
 7190:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7191:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7192:                            ok
 7193:                    end},
 7194:          #{desc => "monitor secondary server 3",
 7195:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7196:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7197:                            ok
 7198:                    end},
 7199: 
 7200:          %% Start the primary server
 7201:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' start",
 7202:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7203:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 7204:                            ok
 7205:                    end},
 7206:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' ready (init)",
 7207:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = State) ->
 7208:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_server, init),
