 7209:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 7210:                    end},
 7211: 
 7212:          %% Start the secondary server 1
 7213:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 1' start",
 7214:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7215:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7216:                            ok
 7217:                    end},
 7218:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 1' ready (init)",
 7219:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7220:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server1, init)
 7221:                    end},
 7222: 
 7223:          %% Start the secondary server 2
 7224:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 2' start",
 7225:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7226:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7227:                            ok
 7228:                    end},
 7229:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 2' ready (init)",
 7230:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7231:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server2, init)
 7232:                    end},
 7233: 
 7234:          %% Start the secondary server 3
 7235:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 3' start",
 7236:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7237:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7238:                            ok
 7239:                    end},
 7240:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 3' ready (init)",
 7241:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7242:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server3, init)
 7243:                    end},
 7244: 
 7245: 
 7246:          %% The actual test
 7247:          %% Make all the seondary servers continue, with an infinite recvfrom
 7248:          %% and then the prim-server with a timed recvfrom.
 7249:          %% After the prim server notifies us (about the timeout) we order it
 7250:          %% to close the socket, which should cause the all the secondary 
 7251:          %% server to return with error-closed.
 7252: 
 7253:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 1' to continue (recv)",
 7254:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7255:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 7256:                            ok
 7257:                    end},
 7258:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7259:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 2' to continue (recv)",
 7260:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7261:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 7262:                            ok
 7263:                    end},
 7264:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7265:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 3' to continue (recv)",
 7266:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7267:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 7268:                            ok
 7269:                    end},
 7270:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7271:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' to continue (recv, with timeout)",
 7272:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7273:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv, ?SECS(5)),
 7274:                            ok
 7275:                    end},
 7276:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' ready (recv, with timeout)",
 7277:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7278:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_server, recv)
 7279:                    end},
 7280:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' to continue (close)",
 7281:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7282:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 7283:                            ok
 7284:                    end},
 7285:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' ready (close)",
 7286:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7287:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_server, close)
 7288:                    end},
 7289:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 1' ready (closed)",
 7290:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7291:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server1, recv_closed)
 7292:                    end},
 7293:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 2' ready (closed)",
 7294:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7295:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server2, recv_closed)
 7296:                    end},
 7297:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 3' ready (closed)",
 7298:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7299:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server3, recv_closed)
 7300:                    end},
 7301: 
 7302:          %% Terminations
 7303:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 3' to terminate",
 7304:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7305:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7306:                            ok
 7307:                    end},
 7308:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 3' termination",
 7309:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = State) ->
 7310:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7311:                                ok ->
 7312:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_server3, State)};
 7313:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7314:                                    ERROR
 7315:                            end
 7316:                    end},
 7317:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 2' to terminate",
 7318:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7319:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7320:                            ok
 7321:                    end},
 7322:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 2' termination",
 7323:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = State) ->
 7324:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7325:                                ok ->
 7326:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_server2, State)};
 7327:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7328:                                    ERROR
 7329:                            end
 7330:                    end},
 7331:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 1' to terminate",
 7332:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7333:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7334:                            ok
 7335:                    end},
 7336:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 1' termination",
 7337:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = State) ->
 7338:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7339:                                ok ->
 7340:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_server1, State)};
 7341:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7342:                                    ERROR
 7343:                            end
 7344:                    end},
 7345:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' to terminate",
 7346:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7347:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7348:                            ok
 7349:                    end},
 7350:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' termination",
 7351:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = State) ->
 7352:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7353:                                ok ->
 7354:                                    {ok, maps:remove(prim_server, State)};
 7355:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7356:                                    ERROR
 7357:                            end
 7358:                    end},
 7359: 
 7360: 
 7361:          %% *** We are done ***
 7362:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7363:         ],
 7364:     
 7365: 
 7366:     i("start 'primary server' evaluator"),
 7367:     PrimSrvInitState = InitState,
 7368:     PrimServer = ?SEV_START("prim-server", PrimServerSeq, PrimSrvInitState),
 7369: 
 7370:     i("start 'secondary server 1' evaluator"),
 7371:     SecSrvInitState = #{recv => maps:get(recv, InitState)},
 7372:     SecServer1 = ?SEV_START("sec-server-1", SecServerSeq, SecSrvInitState),
 7373: 
 7374:     i("start 'secondary server 2' evaluator"),
 7375:     SecServer2 = ?SEV_START("sec-server-2", SecServerSeq, SecSrvInitState),
 7376: 
 7377:     i("start 'secondary server 3' evaluator"),
 7378:     SecServer3 = ?SEV_START("sec-server-3", SecServerSeq, SecSrvInitState),
 7379: 
 7380:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 7381:     TesterInitState = #{prim_server => PrimServer#ev.pid,
 7382:                         sec_server1 => SecServer1#ev.pid,
 7383:                         sec_server2 => SecServer2#ev.pid,
 7384:                         sec_server3 => SecServer3#ev.pid},
 7385:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 7386: 
 7387:     i("await evaluator"),
 7388:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([PrimServer, 
 7389:                             SecServer1, SecServer2, SecServer3,
 7390:                             Tester]).
 7391: 
 7392: 
 7393: 
 7394: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7395: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7396: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
 7397: %% Socket is IPv4.
 7398: 
 7399: sc_lc_recvmsg_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7400:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 7401:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7402:            fun() ->
 7403:                    is_not_windows(), % recvmsg does not work on Windows
 7404:                    has_support_ipv4()
 7405:            end,
 7406:            fun() ->
 7407:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
 7408:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 7409:                                  protocol => tcp,
 7410:                                  recv     => Recv},
 7411:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 7412:            end).
 7413:

 7503: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
 7504: 		   is_not_windows()
 7505: 	   end,
 7506:            fun() ->
 7507:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock, To) end,
 7508:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 7509:                                  protocol => default,

 7511:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
 7512:            end).

 7516: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7517: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7518: %% locally closed while the process is calling the accept function.
 7519: %% We test what happens with a non-controlling_process also, since we 
 7520: %% git the setup anyway.
 7521: %% Socket is IPv4.
 7522: 
 7523: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7524:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 7525:     tc_try(sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp4,
 7526:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 7527:            fun() ->
 7528:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 7529:                                  protocol => tcp},
 7530:                    ok = sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState)
 7531:            end).
 7532: 
 7533: 
 7534: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7535: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7536: %% locally closed while the process is calling the accept function.
 7537: %% We test what happens with a non-controlling_process also, since we 
 7538: %% git the setup anyway.
 7539: %% Socket is IPv6.
 7540: 
 7541: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7542:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 7543:     tc_try(sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp6,
 7544:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 7545:            fun() ->
 7546:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 7547:                                  protocol => tcp},
 7548:                    ok = sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState)
 7549:            end).
 7550: 
 7551: 
 7552: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7553: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7554: %% locally closed while the process is calling the accept function.
 7555: %% We test what happens with a non-controlling_process also, since we 
 7556: %% git the setup anyway.
 7557: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 7558: 
 7559: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7560:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 7561:     tc_try(sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcpL,
 7562:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 7563:            fun() ->
 7564:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 7565:                                  protocol => default},
 7566:                    ok = sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState)
 7567:            end).
 7568: 
 7569: 
 7570: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7571: 
 7572: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 7573:     PrimAcceptorSeq =
 7574:         [
 7575:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 7576:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 7577:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7578:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7579:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 7580:                    end},
 7581:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7582:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7583:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7584:                            ok
 7585:                    end},
 7586: 
 7587:          %% *** Init part ***
 7588:          #{desc => "which local address",
 7589:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 7590:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 7591:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
 7592:                    end},
 7593:          #{desc => "create (listen) socket",
 7594:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 7595:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 7596:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 7597:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 7598:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 7599:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7600:                                    ERROR
 7601:                            end
 7602:                    end},
 7603:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 7604:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
 7605:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
 7606:                                ok ->
 7607:                                    ok;
 7608:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7609:                                    ERROR
 7610:                            end
 7611:                    end},
 7612:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 7613:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock}) ->
 7614:                            socket:listen(Sock)
 7615:                    end},
 7616:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7617:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7618:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 7619:                            ok
 7620:                    end},
 7621: 
 7622:          %% The actual test
 7623:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 7624:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7625:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept) of
 7626:                                {ok, Timeout} ->
 7627:                                    {ok, State#{timeout => Timeout}};
 7628:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7629:                                    ERROR
 7630:                            end
 7631:                    end},
 7632:          #{desc => "await connection",
 7633:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, timeout := Timeout} = _State) ->
 7634:                            case socket:accept(LSock, Timeout) of
 7635:                                {error, timeout} ->
 7636:                                    ok;
 7637:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 7638:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected success"),
 7639:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 7640:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7641:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7642:                                    ERROR
 7643:                            end
 7644:                    end},
 7645:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept timeout)",
 7646:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7647:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_timeout),
 7648:                            ok
 7649:                    end},
 7650:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 7651:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7652:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 7653:                    end},
 7654:          #{desc => "close socket",
 7655:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 7656:                          sock   := Sock,
 7657:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 7658:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7659:                                ok ->
 7660:                                    State1 =
 7661:                                        unlink_path(Path,
 7662:                                                    fun() ->
 7663:                                                            maps:remove(lsa, State)
 7664:                                                    end,
 7665:                                                    fun() ->
 7666:                                                            State
 7667:                                                    end),
 7668:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
 7669:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7670:                                    unlink_path(Path),
 7671:                                    ERROR
 7672:                            end;
 7673:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7674:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7675:                                ok ->
 7676:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7677:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7678:                                    ERROR
 7679:                            end
 7680:                    end},
 7681:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 7682:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7683:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 7684:                            ok
 7685:                    end},
 7686: 
 7687:                                                 % Termination
 7688:          #{desc => "await terminate",
 7689:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7690:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7691:                                ok ->
 7692:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7693:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7694:                                    ERROR
 7695:                            end
 7696:                    end},
 7697: 
 7698:          %% *** We are done ***
 7699:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7700:         ],
 7701: 
 7702:     SecAcceptorSeq =
 7703:         [
 7704:          %% *** Init part ***
 7705:          #{desc => "await start",
 7706:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7707:                            {Tester, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7708:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, sock => Sock}}
 7709:                    end},
 7710:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7711:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7712:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7713:                            ok
 7714:                    end},
 7715:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7716:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7717:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init)
 7718:                    end},
 7719: 
 7720:          %% The actual test
 7721:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 7722:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7723:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 7724:                    end},
 7725:          #{desc => "accept",
 7726:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7727:                            case socket:accept(Sock) of
 7728:                                {error, closed} ->
 7729:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7730:                                {ok, _} ->
 7731:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7732:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7733:                                    ERROR
 7734:                            end
 7735:                    end},
 7736:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept closed)",
 7737:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7738:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_closed)
 7739:                    end},
 7740: 
 7741:          %% Termination
 7742:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 7743:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7744:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7745:                                ok ->
 7746:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7747:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7748:                                    ERROR
 7749:                            end
 7750:                    end},
 7751: 
 7752:          %% *** We are done ***
 7753:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7754:         ],
 7755: 
 7756:     TesterSeq =
 7757:         [
 7758:          %% *** Init part ***
 7759:          #{desc => "monitor 'primary acceptor'",
 7760:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7761:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7762:                            ok
 7763:                    end},
 7764:          #{desc => "monitor 'secondary acceptor 1'",
 7765:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7766:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7767:                            ok
 7768:                    end},
 7769:          #{desc => "monitor secondary acceptor 2",
 7770:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7771:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7772:                            ok
 7773:                    end},
 7774:          #{desc => "monitor secondary acceptor 3",
 7775:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7776:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7777:                            ok
 7778:                    end},
 7779: 
 7780:          %% Start the primary server
 7781:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' start",
 7782:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7783:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 7784:                            ok
 7785:                    end},
 7786:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (init)",
 7787:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = State) ->
 7788:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, init),
 7789:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 7790:                    end},
 7791: 
 7792:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 1
 7793:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' start",
 7794:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7795:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7796:                            ok
 7797:                    end},
 7798:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' ready (init)",
 7799:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7800:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc1, init)
 7801:                    end},
 7802: 
 7803:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 2
 7804:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' start",
 7805:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7806:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7807:                            ok
 7808:                    end},
 7809:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' ready (init)",
 7810:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7811:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc2, init)
 7812:                    end},
 7813: 
 7814:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 3
 7815:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' start",
 7816:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7817:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7818:                            ok
 7819:                    end},
 7820:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' ready (init)",
 7821:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7822:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc3, init)
 7823:                    end},
 7824: 
 7825: 
 7826:          %% The actual test
 7827:          %% Make all the seondary servers continue, with an infinite recvfrom
 7828:          %% and then the prim-server with a timed recvfrom.
 7829:          %% After the prim server notifies us (about the timeout) we order it
 7830:          %% to close the socket, which should cause the all the secondary 
 7831:          %% server to return with error-closed.
 7832: 
 7833:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' to continue (accept)",
 7834:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7835:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7836:                            ok
 7837:                    end},
 7838:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7839:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' to continue (accept)",
 7840:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7841:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7842:                            ok
 7843:                    end},
 7844:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7845:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' to continue (accept)",
 7846:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7847:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7848:                            ok
 7849:                    end},
 7850:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7851:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to continue",
 7852:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7853:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept, ?SECS(5)),
 7854:                            ok
 7855:                    end},
 7856:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (accept timeout)",
 7857:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7858:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, accept_timeout)
 7859:                    end},
 7860:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to continue (close)",
 7861:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7862:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 7863:                            ok
 7864:                    end},
 7865:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (close)",
 7866:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7867:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, close)
 7868:                    end},
 7869:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' ready (accept closed)",
 7870:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7871:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc1, accept_closed)
 7872:                    end},
 7873:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' ready (accept closed)",
 7874:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7875:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc2, accept_closed)
 7876:                    end},
 7877:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' ready (accept closed)",
 7878:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7879:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc3, accept_closed)
 7880:                    end},
 7881: 
 7882: 
 7883:          %% Terminations
 7884:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' to terminate",
 7885:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7886:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7887:                            ok
 7888:                    end},
 7889:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' termination",
 7890:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = State) ->
 7891:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7892:                                ok ->
 7893:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc3, State)};
 7894:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7895:                                    ERROR
 7896:                            end
 7897:                    end},
 7898:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' to terminate",
 7899:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7900:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7901:                            ok
 7902:                    end},
 7903:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' termination",
 7904:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = State) ->
 7905:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7906:                                ok ->
 7907:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc2, State)};
 7908:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7909:                                    ERROR
 7910:                            end
 7911:                    end},
 7912:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' to terminate",
 7913:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7914:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7915:                            ok
 7916:                    end},
 7917:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' termination",
 7918:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = State) ->
 7919:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7920:                                ok ->
 7921:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc1, State)};
 7922:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7923:                                    ERROR
 7924:                            end
 7925:                    end},
 7926:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to terminate",
 7927:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7928:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7929:                            ok
 7930:                    end},
 7931:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' termination",
 7932:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = State) ->
 7933:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7934:                                ok ->
 7935:                                    {ok, maps:remove(prim_acc, State)};
 7936:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7937:                                    ERROR
 7938:                            end
 7939:                    end},
 7940: 
 7941: 
 7942:          %% *** We are done ***
 7943:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7944:         ],
 7945: 
 7946: 
 7947:     i("start 'primary acceptor' evaluator"),
 7948:     PrimAccInitState = InitState,
 7949:     PrimAcc = ?SEV_START("prim-acceptor", PrimAcceptorSeq, PrimAccInitState),
 7950: 
 7951:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 1' evaluator"),
 7952:     SecAccInitState = #{},
 7953:     SecAcc1 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-1", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7954: 
 7955:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 2' evaluator"),
 7956:     SecAcc2 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-2", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7957: 
 7958:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 3' evaluator"),
 7959:     SecAcc3 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-3", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7960: 
 7961:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 7962:     TesterInitState = #{prim_acc => PrimAcc#ev.pid,
 7963:                         sec_acc1 => SecAcc1#ev.pid,
 7964:                         sec_acc2 => SecAcc2#ev.pid,
 7965:                         sec_acc3 => SecAcc3#ev.pid},
 7966:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 7967: 
 7968:     i("await evaluator"),
 7969:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([PrimAcc, SecAcc1, SecAcc2, SecAcc3, Tester]).
 7970: 
 7971: 
 7972: 
 7973: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7974: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7975: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 7976: %% Socket is IPv4.
 7977: %%
 7978: %% To minimize the chance of "weirdness", we should really have test cases
 7979: %% where the two sides of the connection is on different machines. But for
 7980: %% now, we will make do with different VMs on the same host.
 7981: %%
 7982: 
 7983: sc_rc_recv_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7984:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 7985:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7986:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 7987:            fun() ->
 7988:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 7989:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 7990:                                  protocol => tcp,
 7991:                                  recv     => Recv},
 7992:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 7993:            end).
 7994: 
 7995: 
 7996: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7997: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7998: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 7999: %% Socket is IPv6.
 8000: 
 8001: sc_rc_recv_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8002:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8003:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8004:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 8005:            fun() ->
 8006:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 8007:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 8008:                                  protocol => tcp,
 8009:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8010:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8011:            end).
 8012: 
 8013: 
 8014: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8015: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 8016: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 8017: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 8018: 
 8019: sc_rc_recv_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8020:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8021:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8022:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 8023:            fun() ->
 8024:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 8025:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 8026:                                  protocol => default,
 8027:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8028:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8029:            end).
 8030: 
 8031: 
 8032: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8033: 
 8034: sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 8035:     %% Each connection are handled by handler processes.
 8036:     %% These are created (on the fly) and handled internally 
 8037:     %% by the server!
 8038:     ServerSeq =
 8039:         [
 8040:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 8041:          #{desc => "await start",
 8042:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 8043:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 8044:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 8045:                    end},
 8046:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 8047:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8048:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 8049:                            ok
 8050:                    end},
 8051: 
 8052:          %% *** Init part ***
 8053:          #{desc => "which local address",
 8054:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 8055:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 8056:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 8057:                    end},
 8058:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
 8059:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 8060:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 8061:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8062:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
 8063:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8064:                                    ERROR
 8065:                            end
 8066:                    end},
 8067:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 8068:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 8069:                          lsock  := LSock,
 8070:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
 8071:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
 8072:                                ok ->
 8073:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 8074:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8075:                                    ERROR
 8076:                            end;
 8077:                       (#{lsock    := LSock,
 8078:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 8079:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 8080:                                ok ->
 8081:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 8082:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 8083:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8084:                                    ERROR
 8085:                            end
 8086:                    end},
 8087:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 8088:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 8089:                            socket:listen(LSock)
 8090:                    end},
 8091:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 8092:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 8093:                          tester   := Tester,
 8094:                          local_sa := LSA}) ->
 8095:                            %% Actually we only need to send the path,
 8096:                            %% but to keep it simple, we send the "same"
 8097:                            %% as for non-local.
 8098:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, LSA),
 8099:                            ok;
 8100:                       (#{tester := Tester, local_sa := LSA, lport := Port}) ->
 8101:                            ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
 8102:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, ServerSA),
 8103:                            ok
 8104:                    end},
 8105: 
 8106:          %% The actual test
 8107:          #{desc => "await continue (accept all three connections)",
 8108:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8109:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 8110:                    end},
 8111:          #{desc => "accept 1",
 8112:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8113:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8114:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8115:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8116:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(1, Recv, Sock),
 8117:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8118:                                    {ok, State#{csock1   => Sock,
 8119:                                                handler1 => Handler}};
 8120:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8121:                                    ERROR
 8122:                            end
 8123:                    end},
 8124:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (init)",
 8125:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8126:                          handler1 := Handler1} = _State) ->
 8127:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler1, handler1, init, 
 8128:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8129:                    end},
 8130:          #{desc => "accept 2",
 8131:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8132:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8133:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8134:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8135:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(2, Recv, Sock),
 8136:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8137:                                    {ok, State#{csock2   => Sock,
 8138:                                                handler2 => Handler}};
 8139:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8140:                                    ERROR
 8141:                            end
 8142:                    end},
 8143:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (init)",
 8144:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8145:                          handler1 := Handler1, 
 8146:                          handler2 := Handler2} = _State) ->
 8147:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler2, handler2, init, 
 8148:                                             [{tester,   Tester},
 8149:                                              {handler1, Handler1}])
 8150:                    end},
 8151:          #{desc => "accept 3",
 8152:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8153:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8154:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8155:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8156:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(3, Recv, Sock),
 8157:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8158:                                    {ok, State#{csock3   => Sock,
 8159:                                                handler3 => Handler}};
 8160:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8161:                                    ERROR
 8162:                            end
 8163:                    end},
 8164:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (init)",
 8165:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8166:                          handler1 := Handler1, 
 8167:                          handler2 := Handler2, 
 8168:                          handler3 := Handler3} = _State) ->
 8169:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler3, handler3, init, 
 8170:                                             [{tester,   Tester},
 8171:                                              {handler1, Handler1},
 8172:                                              {handler2, Handler2}])
 8173:                    end},
 8174:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept all three connections)",
 8175:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8176:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
 8177:                            ok
 8178:                    end},
 8179: 
 8180: 
 8181:          #{desc => "await continue (recv)",
 8182:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8183:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv)
 8184:                    end},
 8185:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to receive",
 8186:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8187:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8188:                            ok
 8189:                    end},
 8190:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to receive",
 8191:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8192:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8193:                            ok
 8194:                    end},
 8195:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to receive",
 8196:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8197:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8198:                            ok
 8199:                    end},
 8200:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 1 (recv)",
 8201:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8202:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8203:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8204:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8205:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid1, handler1, recv, 
 8206:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8207:                                                   {handler2, Pid2},
 8208:                                                   {handler3, Pid3}]) of
 8209:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8210:                                    Result;
 8211:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 8212:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected failure: "
 8213:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8214:                                    ERROR
 8215:                            end
 8216:                    end},
 8217:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 2 (recv)",
 8218:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8219:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8220:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8221:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8222:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid2, handler2, recv, 
 8223:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8224:                                                   {handler1, Pid1},
 8225:                                                   {handler3, Pid3}]) of
 8226:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8227:                                    Result;
 8228:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8229:                                    ERROR
 8230:                            end
 8231:                    end},
 8232:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 3 (recv)",
 8233:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8234:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8235:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8236:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8237:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid3, handler3, recv, 
 8238:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8239:                                                   {handler1, Pid1},
 8240:                                                   {handler2, Pid2}]) of
 8241:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8242:                                    Result;
 8243:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8244:                                    ERROR
 8245:                            end
 8246:                    end},
 8247:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed from all handlers)",
 8248:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8249:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
 8250:                            ok
 8251:                    end},
 8252: 
 8253:          %% Termination
 8254:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 8255:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 8256:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 8257:                                ok ->
 8258:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 8259:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8260:                                    ERROR
 8261:                            end
 8262:                    end},
 8263:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to terminate",
 8264:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8265:                            %% Pid ! {terminate, self(), ok},
 8266:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8267:                            ok
 8268:                    end},
 8269:          #{desc => "await handler 1 termination",
 8270:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = State) ->
 8271:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8272:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock1,   State),
 8273:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler1, State1),
 8274:                            {ok, State2}
 8275:                    end},
 8276:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to terminate",
 8277:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8278:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8279:                            ok
 8280:                    end},
 8281:          #{desc => "await handler 2 termination",
 8282:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = State) ->
 8283:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8284:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock2,   State),
 8285:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler2, State1),
 8286:                            {ok, State2}
 8287:                    end},
 8288:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to terminate",
 8289:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8290:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8291:                            ok
 8292:                    end},
 8293:          #{desc => "await handler 3 termination",
 8294:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = State) ->
 8295:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8296:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock3,   State),
 8297:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler3, State1),
 8298:                            {ok, State2}
 8299:                    end},
 8300:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
 8301:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 8302:                          lsock  := LSock,
 8303:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 8304:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
 8305:                                ok ->
 8306:                                    State1 =
 8307:                                        unlink_path(Path,
 8308:                                                    fun() ->
 8309:                                                            maps:remove(lsa, State)
 8310:                                                    end,
 8311:                                                    fun() ->
 8312:                                                            State
 8313:                                                    end),
 8314:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
 8315:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8316:                                    unlink_path(Path),
 8317:                                    ERROR
 8318:                            end;
 8319:                       (#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
 8320:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
 8321:                                ok ->
 8322:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)};
 8323:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8324:                                    ERROR
 8325:                            end
 8326:                    end},
 8327: 
 8328:          %% *** We are done ***
 8329:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8330:         ],
 8331: 
 8332:     ClientSeq =
 8333:         [
 8334:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 8335:          #{desc => "await start",
 8336:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 8337:                            {Tester, {NodeID, ServerSA}} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 8338:                            {ok, State#{tester    => Tester, 
 8339:                                        node_id   => NodeID, 
 8340:                                        server_sa => ServerSA}}
 8341:                    end},
 8342:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 8343:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8344:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 8345:                            ok
 8346:                    end},
 8347: 
 8348:          %% *** Init part ***
 8349:          #{desc => "create node",
 8350:            cmd  => fun(#{node_id := NodeID} = State) ->
 8351:                            {Peer, Node} =
 8352:                                start_node(?CT_PEER_NAME(?F("client_~w",
 8353:                                                            [NodeID]))),
 8354:                            {ok, State#{node => Node, peer => Peer}}
 8355:                    end},
 8356:          #{desc => "monitor client node 1",
 8357:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) ->
 8358:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 8359:                            ok
 8360:                    end},
 8361:          #{desc => "start remote client on client node",
 8362:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = State) ->
 8363:                            Pid = sc_rc_tcp_client_start(Node),
 8364:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("client ~p started", [Pid]),
 8365:                            {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}}
 8366:                    end},
 8367:          #{desc => "monitor remote client",
 8368:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Pid}) ->
 8369:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8370:                            ok
 8371:                    end},
 8372:          #{desc => "order remote client to start",
 8373:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient   := Client,
 8374:                          server_sa := ServerSA,
 8375:                          protocol  := Proto}) ->
 8376:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Client, {ServerSA, Proto}),
 8377:                            ok
 8378:                    end},
 8379:          #{desc => "await remote client ready",
 8380:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8381:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8382:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, init, 
 8383:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8384:                    end},
 8385:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 8386:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8387:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 8388:                            ok
 8389:                    end},
 8390: 
 8391:          %% The actual test
 8392:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
 8393:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8394:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8395:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect, 
 8396:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 8397:                            ok
 8398:                    end},
 8399:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (connect)",
 8400:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 8401:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, connect),
 8402:                            ok
 8403:                    end},
 8404:          #{desc => "await client process ready (connect)",
 8405:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8406:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8407:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, connect, 
 8408:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8409:                    end},
 8410:          #{desc => "announce ready (connected)",
 8411:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8412:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
 8413:                            ok
 8414:                    end},
 8415:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 8416:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8417:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8418:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close, 
 8419:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 8420:                            ok
 8421:                    end},
 8422:          #{desc => "order remote client to close",
 8423:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 8424:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, close),
 8425:                            ok
 8426:                    end},
 8427:          #{desc => "await remote client ready (closed)",
 8428:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8429:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8430:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, close, 
 8431:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8432:                    end},
 8433:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 8434:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8435:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 8436:                            ok
 8437:                    end},
 8438: 
 8439:          %% Termination
 8440:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 8441:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester, 
 8442:                          rclient := Client} = State) ->
 8443:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester,
 8444:                                                      [{rclient, Client}]) of
 8445:                                ok ->
 8446:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 8447:                                {error,
 8448:                                 {unexpected_exit, rclient, noconnection}} ->
 8449:                                    %% Global might have disconnected => SKIP
 8450:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("lost connection "
 8451:                                                "to remote client node => SKIP"),
 8452:                                    {skip, {rclient, noconnection}};
 8453:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8454:                                    ERROR
 8455:                            end
 8456:                    end},
 8457:          #{desc => "kill remote client",
 8458:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient}) ->
 8459:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("try kill remote client ~p", [RClient]),
 8460:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(RClient),
 8461:                            ok
 8462:                    end},
 8463:          #{desc => "await remote client termination",
 8464:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient} = State) ->
 8465:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(RClient),
 8466:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("remote client ~p terminated",
 8467:                                        [RClient]),
 8468:                            State1 = maps:remove(rclient, State),
 8469:                            {ok, State1}
 8470:                    end},
 8471:          #{desc => "stop client node",
 8472:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State) ->
 8473:                            {ok,
 8474:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
 8475:                                 ok ->
 8476:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
 8477:                                 {error, Reason} ->
 8478:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 8479:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8480:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 8481:                             catch
 8482:                                 C:E:S ->
 8483:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 8484:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
 8485:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
 8486:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
 8487:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 8488:                             end}
 8489:                    end},
 8490:          #{desc => "await client node termination",
 8491:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node, node_stop := ok} = State) ->
 8492:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown: "
 8493:                                        "~n      ~p", [Node]),
 8494:                            receive
 8495:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
 8496:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
 8497:                                    State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
 8498:                                    State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
 8499:                                    {ok, State2}
 8500:                            end;
 8501:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
 8502:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
 8503:                            State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
 8504:                            State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
 8505:                            {ok, State2}
 8506:                    end},
 8507: 
 8508:          %% *** We are done ***
 8509:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8510:         ],
 8511: 
 8512:     TesterSeq =
 8513:         [
 8514:          %% *** Init part ***
 8515:          #{desc => "monitor server",
 8516:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 8517:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8518:                            ok
 8519:                    end},
 8520:          #{desc => "monitor client 1",
 8521:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8522:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8523:                            ok
 8524:                    end},
 8525:          #{desc => "monitor client 2",
 8526:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8527:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8528:                            ok
 8529:                    end},
 8530:          #{desc => "monitor client 3",
 8531:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8532:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8533:                            ok
 8534:                    end},
 8535: 
 8536:          %% Start the server
 8537:          #{desc => "order server start",
 8538:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 8539:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 8540:                            ok
 8541:                    end},
 8542:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
 8543:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 8544:                            {ok, ServerSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
 8545:                            {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}}
 8546:                    end},

 8548:          %% Start the client(s)
 8549:          #{desc => "order client 1 start",
