 8551:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
 8552:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, {1, ServerSA}),
 8553:                            ok
 8554:                    end},
 8555:          #{desc => "await client 1 ready (init)",
 8556:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8557:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client1, init)
 8558:                    end},
 8559:          #{desc => "order client 2 start",
 8560:            cmd  => fun(#{client2   := Pid, 
 8561:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
 8562:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, {2, ServerSA}),
 8563:                            ok
 8564:                    end},
 8565:          #{desc => "await client 2 ready (init)",
 8566:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8567:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client2, init)
 8568:                    end},
 8569:          #{desc => "order client 3 start",
 8570:            cmd  => fun(#{client3   := Pid, 
 8571:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
 8572:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, {3, ServerSA}),
 8573:                            ok
 8574:                    end},
 8575:          #{desc => "await client 3 ready (init)",
 8576:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8577:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client3, init)
 8578:                    end},
 8579: 
 8580:          %% The actual test
 8581:          #{desc => "order server continue (accept)",
 8582:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 8583:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 8584:                            ok
 8585:                    end},
 8586:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 8587:          #{desc => "order client 1 continue (connect)",
 8588:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8589:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect),
 8590:                            ok
 8591:                    end},
 8592:          #{desc => "await client 1 ready (connect)",
 8593:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8594:                          client1 := Client1,
 8595:                          client2 := Client2,
 8596:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8597:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client1, client1, connect, 
 8598:                                             [{server,  Server},
 8599:                                              {client2, Client2},
 8600:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
 8601:                            ok
 8602:                    end},
 8603:          #{desc => "order client 2 continue (connect)",
 8604:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8605:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect),
 8606:                            ok
 8607:                    end},
 8608:          #{desc => "await client 2 ready (connect)",
 8609:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8610:                          client1 := Client1,
 8611:                          client2 := Client2,
 8612:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8613:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client2, client2, connect, 
 8614:                                             [{server,  Server},
 8615:                                              {client1, Client1},
 8616:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
 8617:                            ok
 8618:                    end},
 8619:          #{desc => "order client 3 continue (connect)",
 8620:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8621:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect),
 8622:                            ok
 8623:                    end},
 8624:          #{desc => "await client 3 ready (connect)",
 8625:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8626:                          client1 := Client1,
 8627:                          client2 := Client2,
 8628:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8629:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client3, client3, connect, 
 8630:                                             [{server,  Server},
 8631:                                              {client1, Client1},
 8632:                                              {client2, Client2}]),
 8633:                            ok
 8634:                    end},
 8635:          #{desc => "await server ready (accept from all connections)",
 8636:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8637:                          client1 := Client1,
 8638:                          client2 := Client2,
 8639:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8640:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, accept,
 8641:                                             [{client1, Client1},
 8642:                                              {client2, Client2},
 8643:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
 8644:                            ok
 8645:                    end},
 8646:          #{desc => "order server continue (recv for all connections)",
 8647:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 8648:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8649:                            ok
 8650:                    end},
 8651:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 8652:          #{desc => "order client 1 continue (close)",
 8653:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8654:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 8655:                            ok
 8656:                    end},
 8657:          #{desc => "await client 1 ready (close)",
 8658:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8659:                          client1 := Client1,
 8660:                          client2 := Client2,
 8661:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8662:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client1, client1, close, 
 8663:                                             [{server,  Server},
 8664:                                              {client2, Client2},
 8665:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
 8666:                            ok
 8667:                    end},
 8668:          #{desc => "order client 2 continue (close)",
 8669:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8670:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 8671:                            ok
 8672:                    end},
 8673:          #{desc => "await client 2 ready (close)",
 8674:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8675:                          client1 := Client1,
 8676:                          client2 := Client2,
 8677:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8678:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client2, client2, close, 
 8679:                                             [{server,  Server},
 8680:                                              {client1, Client1},
 8681:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
 8682:                            ok
 8683:                    end},
 8684:          #{desc => "order client 3 continue (close)",
 8685:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8686:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 8687:                            ok
 8688:                    end},
 8689:          #{desc => "await client 3 ready (close)",
 8690:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8691:                          client1 := Client1,
 8692:                          client2 := Client2,
 8693:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8694:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client3, client1, close, 
 8695:                                             [{server,  Server},
 8696:                                              {client1, Client1},
 8697:                                              {client2, Client2}]),
 8698:                            ok
 8699:                    end},
 8700:          #{desc => "await server ready (close for all connections)",
 8701:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8702:                          client1 := Client1,
 8703:                          client2 := Client2,
 8704:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8705:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_closed,
 8706:                                             [{client1, Client1},
 8707:                                              {client2, Client2},
 8708:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
 8709:                            ok
 8710:                    end},
 8711: 
 8712:          %% Terminations
 8713:          #{desc => "order client 1 to terminate",
 8714:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8715:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8716:                            ok
 8717:                    end},
 8718:          #{desc => "await client 1 termination",
 8719:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = State) ->
 8720:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 8721:                                ok ->
 8722:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client1, State),
 8723:                                    {ok, State1};
 8724:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8725:                                    ERROR
 8726:                            end
 8727:                    end},
 8728:          #{desc => "order client 2 to terminate",
 8729:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8730:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8731:                            ok
 8732:                    end},
 8733:          #{desc => "await client 2 termination",
 8734:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = State) ->
 8735:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 8736:                                ok ->
 8737:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client2, State),
 8738:                                    {ok, State1};
 8739:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8740:                                    ERROR
 8741:                            end
 8742:                    end},
 8743:          #{desc => "order client 3 to terminate",
 8744:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8745:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8746:                            ok
 8747:                    end},
 8748:          #{desc => "await client 3 termination",
 8749:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = State) ->
 8750:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 8751:                                ok ->
 8752:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client3, State),
 8753:                                    {ok, State1};
 8754:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8755:                                    ERROR
 8756:                            end
 8757:                    end},
 8758:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
 8759:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 8760:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8761:                            ok
 8762:                    end},
 8763:          #{desc => "await server termination",
 8764:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 8765:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 8766:                                ok ->
 8767:                                    State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 8768:                                    {ok, State1};
 8769:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8770:                                    ERROR
 8771:                            end
 8772:                    end},
 8773: 
 8774:          %% *** We are done ***
 8775:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8776:         ],
 8777: 
 8778:     i("start server evaluator"),
 8779:     ServerInitState = InitState,
 8780:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 8781: 
 8782:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 8783:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 8784:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8785:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8786:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8787: 
 8788:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 8789:     TesterInitState = #{server  => Server#ev.pid,
 8790:                         client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 8791:                         client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 8792:                         client3 => Client3#ev.pid},
 8793:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 8794: 
 8795:     i("await evaluator"),
 8796:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server,
 8797:                             Client1, Client2, Client3,
 8798:                             Tester]).
 8799: 
 8800: 
 8801: sc_rc_tcp_client_start(Node) ->
 8802:     Self = self(),
 8803:     Fun  = fun() -> sc_rc_tcp_client(Self) end,
 8804:     erlang:spawn(Node, Fun).
 8805: 
 8806: 
 8807: sc_rc_tcp_client(Parent) ->
 8808:     sc_rc_tcp_client_init(Parent),
 8809:     {ServerSA, Proto} = sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent),
 8810:     Domain   = maps:get(family, ServerSA),
 8811:     Sock     = sc_rc_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto),
 8812:     Path     = sc_rc_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain),
 8813:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, init),
 8814:     sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, connect),
 8815:     sc_rc_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA),
 8816:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, connect),
 8817:     sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, close),
 8818:     sc_rc_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path),
 8819:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, close),
 8820:     Reason = sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent),
 8821:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminate"),
 8822:     exit(Reason).
 8823: 
 8824: sc_rc_tcp_client_init(Parent) ->
 8825:     put(sname, "rclient"),
 8826:     ?SEV_IPRINT("init"),
 8827:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 8828:     ok.
 8829: 
 8830: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent) ->
 8831:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start -> entry"),
 8832:     ?SEV_AWAIT_START(Parent).
 8833: 
 8834: sc_rc_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto) ->
 8835:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_create -> entry"),
 8836:     case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 8837:         {ok, Sock} ->
 8838:             case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, fd) of
 8839:                 {ok, FD} ->
 8840:                     put(sname, ?F("rclient-~w", [FD])); % Update SName
 8841:                 _ ->
 8842:                     ok
 8843:             end,
 8844:             Sock;
 8845:         {error, Reason} ->
 8846:             exit({open_failed, Reason})
 8847:     end.
 8848: 
 8849: sc_rc_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain) ->
 8850:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_bind -> entry"),
 8851:     LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 8852:     case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 8853:         ok ->
 8854:             case socket:sockname(Sock) of
 8855:                 {ok, #{family := local, path := Path}} ->
 8856:                     Path;
 8857:                 {ok, _} ->
 8858:                     undefined;
 8859:                 {error, Reason1} ->
 8860:                     exit({sockname, Reason1})
 8861:             end;
 8862:         {error, Reason} ->
 8863:             exit({bind, Reason})
 8864:     end.
 8865: 
 8866: sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8867:     ?SEV_IPRINT("ready ~w", [Slogan]),
 8868:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan).
 8869: 
 8870: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8871:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w continue", [Slogan]),
 8872:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
 8873: 
 8874: sc_rc_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA) ->
 8875:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_connect -> entry"),
 8876:     case socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA) of
 8877:         ok ->
 8878:             ok;
 8879:         {error, Reason} ->
 8880:             exit({connect, Reason})
 8881:     end.
 8882: 
 8883: sc_rc_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path) ->
 8884:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_close -> entry"),
 8885:     case socket:close(Sock) of
 8886:         ok ->
 8887:             unlink_path(Path),
 8888:             ok;
 8889:         {error, Reason} ->
 8890:             ?SEV_EPRINT("failed closing: "
 8891:                         "~n   Reason: ~p", [Reason]),
 8892:             unlink_path(Path),
 8893:             {error, {close, Reason}}
 8894:     end.
 8895: 
 8896: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent) ->
 8897:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate -> entry"),
 8898:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, parent) of
 8899:         ok ->
 8900:             ok;
 8901:         {error, Reason} ->
 8902:             Reason
 8903:     end.
 8904: 
 8905: 
 8906: %% The handlers run on the same node as the server (the local node).
 8907: 
 8908: sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(ID, Recv, Sock) ->
 8909:     Self     = self(),
 8910:     Fun      = fun() -> sc_rc_tcp_handler(ID, Self, Recv, Sock) end,
 8911:     {Pid, _} = erlang:spawn_monitor(Fun),
 8912:     Pid.
 8913: 
 8914: sc_rc_tcp_handler(ID, Parent, Recv, Sock) ->
 8915:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_init(ID, socket:getopt(Sock, otp, fd), Parent),
 8916:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, recv),
 8917:     RecvRes = sc_rc_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock),
 8918:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, recv, RecvRes),
 8919:     Reason = sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate),
 8920:     exit(Reason).
 8921: 
 8922: sc_rc_tcp_handler_init(ID, {ok, FD}, Parent) ->
 8923:     put(sname, ?F("handler-~w:~w", [ID, FD])),
 8924:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 8925:     ?SEV_IPRINT("started"),
 8926:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, init),
 8927:     ok.
 8928: 
 8929: sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate) ->
 8930:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await terminate"),
 8931:     ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, tester);
 8932: sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8933:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w", [Slogan]),
 8934:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
 8935: 
 8936: sc_rc_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock) ->
 8937:     ?SEV_IPRINT("recv"),
 8938:     try Recv(Sock) of
 8939:         {error, closed} ->
 8940:             ok;
 8941:         {ok, Data} ->
 8942:             ?SEV_IPRINT("unexpected success: "
 8943:                         "~n   (Unexp) Data: ~p"
 8944:                         "~n   Socket Info:  ~p", [Data, socket:info(Sock)]),
 8945:             {error, unexpected_success};
 8946:         {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 8947:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive error: "
 8948:                         "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8949:             ERROR
 8950:     catch
 8951:         error:notsup = Error:Stack ->
 8952:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive ~w error: skip"
 8953:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [Error, Stack]),
 8954:             exit({skip, Error});
 8955:         C:E:S ->
 8956:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive failure: "
 8957:                         "~n   Class: ~p"
 8958:                         "~n   Error: ~p"
 8959:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 8960:             {error, {recv, C, E, S}}
 8961:     end.
 8962: 
 8963: sc_rc_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan, Result) ->
 8964:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready"),
 8965:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan, Result),
 8966:     ok.
 8967: 
 8968: 
 8969: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8970: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 8971: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
 8972: %% Socket is IPv4.
 8973: 
 8974: sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8975:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8976:     tc_try(sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp4,
 8977:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 8978:            fun() ->
 8979:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
 8980:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 8981:                                  protocol => tcp,
 8982:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8983:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8984:            end).
 8985: 
 8986: 
 8987: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8988: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 8989: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
 8990: %% Socket is IPv6.
 8991: 
 8992: sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8993:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8994:     tc_try(sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp6,
 8995:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 8996:            fun() ->
 8997:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
 8998:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 8999:                                  protocol => tcp,
 9000:                                  recv     => Recv},
 9001:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 9002:            end).
 9003: 
 9004: 
 9005: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9006: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 9007: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
 9008: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 9009: 
 9010: sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 9011:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 9012:     tc_try(sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcpL,
 9013:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 9014:            fun() ->
 9015:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
 9016:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 9017:                                  protocol => default,
 9018:                                  recv     => Recv},
 9019:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 9020:            end).
 9021: 
 9022: 
 9023: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9024: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is
 9025: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 9026: %% The remote client sends data, then shutdown(write) and then the
 9027: %% reader attempts a recv.
 9028: %% Socket is IPv4.
 9029: %%
 9030: %% To minimize the chance of "weirdness", we should really have test cases
 9031: %% where the two sides of the connection is on different machines. But for
 9032: %% now, we will make do with different VMs on the same host.
 9033: %% This would of course not work for Unix Domain sockets.
 9034: %%
 9035: 
 9036: sc_rs_recv_send_shutdown_receive_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 9037:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 9038:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 9039:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 9040:            fun() ->
 9041:                    MsgData   = ?DATA,
 9042:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) ->
 9043:                                        socket:recv(Sock)
 9044:                                end,
 9045:                    Send      = fun(Sock, Data) ->
 9046:                                        socket:send(Sock, Data)
 9047:                                end,
 9048:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
 9049:                                  proto  => tcp,
 9050:                                  recv   => Recv,
 9051:                                  send   => Send,
 9052:                                  data   => MsgData},
 9053:                    ok = sc_rs_send_shutdown_receive_tcp(InitState)
 9054:            end).
 9055: 
 9056: 
 9057: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9058: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is
 9059: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 9060: %% The remote client sends data, then shutdown(write) and then the
 9061: %% reader attempts a recv.
 9062: %% Socket is IPv6.
 9063: 
 9064: sc_rs_recv_send_shutdown_receive_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 9065:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 9066:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 9067:            fun() ->
 9068:                    ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 9069:                    MsgData   = ?DATA,
 9070:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) ->
 9071:                                        socket:recv(Sock)
 9072:                                end,
 9073:                    Send      = fun(Sock, Data) ->
 9074:                                        socket:send(Sock, Data)
 9075:                                end,
 9076:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
 9077:                                  proto  => tcp,
 9078:                                  recv   => Recv,
 9079:                                  send   => Send,
 9080:                                  data   => MsgData},
 9081:                    ok = sc_rs_send_shutdown_receive_tcp(InitState)
 9082:            end).
 9083: 
 9084: 
 9085: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9086: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is
 9087: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 9088: %% The remote client sends data, then shutdown(write) and then the
 9089: %% reader attempts a recv.
 9090: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 9091: 
 9092: sc_rs_recv_send_shutdown_receive_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 9093:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 9094:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 9095:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 9096:            fun() ->
 9097:                    MsgData   = ?DATA,
 9098:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) ->
 9099:                                        socket:recv(Sock)
 9100:                                end,
 9101:                    Send      = fun(Sock, Data) ->
 9102:                                        socket:send(Sock, Data)
 9103:                                end,
 9104:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
 9105:                                  proto  => default,
 9106:                                  recv   => Recv,
 9107:                                  send   => Send,
 9108:                                  data   => MsgData},
 9109:                    ok = sc_rs_send_shutdown_receive_tcp(InitState)
 9110:            end).
 9111: 
 9112: 
 9113: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9114: 
 9115: sc_rs_send_shutdown_receive_tcp(InitState) ->
 9116:     %% The connection is handled by a handler processes.
 9117:     %% This are created (on the fly) and handled internally
 9118:     %% by the server!
 9119:     ServerSeq =
 9120:         [
 9121:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 9122:          #{desc => "await start",
 9123:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 9124:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 9125:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 9126:                    end},
 9127:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 9128:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 9129:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 9130:                            ok
 9131:                    end},
 9132: 
 9133:          %% *** Init part ***
 9134:          #{desc => "which local address",
 9135:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 9136:                            i("get local address for ~p", [Domain]),
 9137:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 9138:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 9139:                    end},
 9140:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
 9141:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, proto := Proto} = State) ->
 9142:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 9143:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 9144:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
 9145:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9146:                                    ERROR
 9147:                            end
 9148:                    end},
 9149:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 9150:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 9151:                          lsock    := LSock,
 9152:                          local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
 9153:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
 9154:                                ok ->
 9155:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 9156:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9157:                                    ERROR
 9158:                            end;
 9159:                       (#{lsock := LSock, local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 9160:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 9161:                                ok ->
 9162:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 9163:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
 9164:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 9165:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9166:                                    ERROR
 9167:                            end
 9168:                    end},
 9169:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 9170:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 9171:                            socket:listen(LSock)
 9172:                    end},
 9173:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 9174:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 9175:                          tester := Tester, local_sa := LSA}) ->
 9176:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, LSA),
 9177:                            ok;
 9178:                       (#{tester := Tester, local_sa := LSA, lport := Port}) ->
 9179:                            ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
 9180:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, ServerSA),
 9181:                            ok
 9182:                    end},
 9183: 
 9184:          %% The actual test
 9185:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 9186:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 9187:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 9188:                    end},
 9189:          #{desc => "accept",
 9190:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 9191:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 9192:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 9193:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 9194:                                    Handler =
 9195:                                        sc_rs_tcp_handler_start(Recv, Sock),
 9196:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 9197:                                    {ok, State#{csock   => Sock,
 9198:                                                handler => Handler}};
 9199:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9200:                                    ERROR
 9201:                            end
 9202:                    end},
 9203:          #{desc => "await handler ready (init)",
 9204:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 9205:                          handler := Handler} = _State) ->
 9206:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler, handler, init,
 9207:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 9208:                    end},
 9209:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
 9210:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 9211:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
 9212:                            ok
 9213:                    end},
 9214: 
 9215:          #{desc => "await continue (first recv)",
 9216:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 9217:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv)
 9218:                    end},
 9219:          #{desc => "order handler to receive (first)",
 9220:            cmd  => fun(#{handler := Pid} = _State) ->
 9221:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 9222:                            ok
 9223:                    end},
 9224:          #{desc => "await ready from handler (first recv)",
 9225:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, handler := Pid} = _State) ->
 9226:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler, recv,
 9227:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
 9228:                                {ok, Result} ->
 9229:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("first recv: ~p", [Result]),
 9230:                                    ok;
 9231:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9232:                                    ERROR
 9233:                            end
 9234:                    end},
 9235:          #{desc => "announce ready (first recv)",
 9236:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 9237:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv),
 9238:                            ok
 9239:                    end},
 9240:          #{desc => "await continue (second recv)",
 9241:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 9242:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv)
 9243:                    end},
 9244:          #{desc => "order handler to receive (second)",
 9245:            cmd  => fun(#{handler := Pid} = _State) ->
 9246:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 9247:                            ok
 9248:                    end},
 9249:          #{desc => "await ready from handler (second recv)",
 9250:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, handler := Pid} = _State) ->
 9251:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler, recv,
 9252:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
 9253:                                {ok, Result} ->
 9254:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("second recv: ~p", [Result]),
 9255:                                    ok;
 9256:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9257:                                    ERROR
 9258:                            end
 9259:                    end},
 9260:          #{desc => "announce ready (second recv)",
 9261:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 9262:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv),
 9263:                            ok
 9264:                    end},
 9265: 
 9266:          %% Termination
 9267:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 9268:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 9269:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 9270:                                ok ->
 9271:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 9272:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9273:                                    ERROR
 9274:                            end
 9275:                    end},
 9276:          #{desc => "order handler to terminate",
 9277:            cmd  => fun(#{handler := Pid} = _State) ->
 9278:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 9279:                            ok
 9280:                    end},
 9281:          #{desc => "await handler termination",
 9282:            cmd  => fun(#{handler := Pid} = State) ->
 9283:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 9284:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock,   State),
 9285:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler, State1),
 9286:                            {ok, State2}
 9287:                    end},
 9288:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
 9289:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 9290:                          lsock    := Sock,
 9291:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 9292:                            socket:close(Sock),
 9293:                            State1 =
 9294:                                unlink_path(Path,
 9295:                                            fun() ->
 9296:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
 9297:                                            end,
 9298:                                            fun() -> State end),
 9299:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
 9300:                       (#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
 9301:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
 9302:                                ok ->
 9303:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)};
 9304:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9305:                                    ERROR
 9306:                            end
 9307:                    end},
 9308: 
 9309:          %% *** We are done ***
 9310:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 9311:         ],
 9312: 
 9313:     ClientSeq =
 9314:         [
 9315:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 9316:          #{desc => "await start",
 9317:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 9318:                            {Tester, ServerSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 9319:                            {ok, State#{tester    => Tester, 
 9320:                                        server_sa => ServerSA}}
 9321:                    end},
 9322:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 9323:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 9324:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 9325:                            ok
 9326:                    end},
 9327: 
 9328:          %% *** Init part ***
 9329:          #{desc => "create node",
 9330:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 9331:                            {Peer, Node} = start_node("client"),
 9332:                            {ok, State#{peer => Peer, node => Node}}
 9333:                    end},
 9334:          #{desc => "monitor client node",
 9335:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) ->
 9336:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 9337:                            ok
 9338:                    end},
 9339:          #{desc => "start remote client on client node",
 9340:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node,
 9341:                          send := Send} = State) ->
 9342:                            Pid = sc_rs_tcp_client_start(Node, Send),
 9343:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("client ~p started", [Pid]),
 9344:                            {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}}
 9345:                    end},
 9346:          #{desc => "monitor remote client",
 9347:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Pid}) ->
 9348:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 9349:                            ok
 9350:                    end},
 9351:          #{desc => "order remote client to start",
 9352:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient   := Client,
 9353:                          proto     := Proto,
 9354:                          server_sa := ServerSA}) ->
 9355:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Client, {ServerSA, Proto}),
 9356:                            ok
 9357:                    end},
 9358:          #{desc => "await remote client ready",
 9359:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 9360:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 9361:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, init, 
 9362:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 9363:                    end},
 9364:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 9365:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 9366:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 9367:                            ok
 9368:                    end},
 9369: 
 9370:          %% The actual test
 9371:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
 9372:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 9373:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 9374:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect, 
 9375:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 9376:                            ok
 9377:                    end},
 9378:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (connect)",
 9379:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 9380:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, connect),
 9381:                            ok
 9382:                    end},
 9383:          #{desc => "await client process ready (connect)",
 9384:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 9385:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 9386:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, connect,
 9387:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 9388:                    end},
 9389:          #{desc => "announce ready (connect)",
 9390:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 9391:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
 9392:                            ok
 9393:                    end},
 9394: 
 9395:          #{desc => "await continue (send)",
 9396:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 9397:                          rclient := Client} = State) ->
 9398:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send,
 9399:                                                     [{rclient, Client}]) of
 9400:                                {ok, Data} ->
 9401:                                    {ok, State#{rclient_data => Data}};
 9402:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9403:                                    ERROR
 9404:                            end
 9405:                    end},
 9406:          #{desc => "order remote client to send",
 9407:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient      := Client,
 9408:                          rclient_data := Data}) ->
 9409:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, Data),
 9410:                            ok
 9411:                    end},
 9412:          #{desc => "await remote client ready (closed)",
 9413:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 9414:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 9415:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send,
 9416:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 9417:                    end},
 9418:          #{desc => "announce ready (send)",
 9419:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 9420:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send),
 9421:                            ok
 9422:                    end},
 9423: 
 9424: 
 9425:          #{desc => "await continue (shutdown)",
 9426:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 9427:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 9428:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, shutdown,
 9429:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 9430:                            ok
 9431:                    end},
 9432:          #{desc => "order remote client to shutdown",
 9433:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 9434:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, shutdown),
 9435:                            ok
 9436:                    end},
 9437:          #{desc => "await remote client ready (shiutdown)",
 9438:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 9439:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 9440:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, shutdown,
 9441:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 9442:                    end},
 9443:          #{desc => "announce ready (shutdown)",
 9444:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 9445:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, shutdown),
 9446:                            ok
 9447:                    end},
 9448: 
 9449:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 9450:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 9451:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 9452:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close,
 9453:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 9454:                            ok
 9455:                    end},
 9456:          #{desc => "order remote client to close",
 9457:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 9458:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, close),
 9459:                            ok
 9460:                    end},
 9461:          #{desc => "await remote client ready (closed)",
 9462:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 9463:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 9464:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, close,
 9465:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 9466:                    end},
 9467:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 9468:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 9469:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 9470:                            ok
 9471:                    end},
 9472: 
 9473:          %% Termination
 9474:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 9475:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 9476:                          rclient := Client} = State) ->
 9477:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester,
 9478:                                                      [{rclient, Client}]) of
 9479:                                ok ->
 9480:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 9481:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9482:                                    ERROR
 9483:                            end
 9484:                    end},
 9485:          #{desc => "kill remote client",
 9486:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 9487:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Client),
 9488:                            ok
 9489:                    end},
 9490:          #{desc => "await remote client termination",
 9491:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client} = State) ->
 9492:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Client),
 9493:                            State1 = maps:remove(rclient, State),
 9494:                            {ok, State1}
 9495:                    end},
 9496:          #{desc => "stop client node",
 9497:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State) ->
 9498:                            {ok,
 9499:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
 9500:                                 ok ->
 9501:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
 9502:                                 {error, Reason} ->
 9503:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 9504:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 9505:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 9506:                             catch
 9507:                                 C:E:S ->
 9508:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 9509:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
 9510:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
 9511:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
 9512:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 9513:                             end}
 9514:                    end},
 9515:          #{desc => "await client node termination",
 9516:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node, node_stop := ok} = State) ->
 9517:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown"),
 9518:                            receive
 9519:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
 9520:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
 9521:                                    State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
 9522:                                    State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
 9523:                                    {ok, State2}
 9524:                            end;
 9525:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
 9526:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
 9527:                            State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
 9528:                            State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
 9529:                            {ok, State2}
 9530:                    end},
 9531: 
 9532:          %% *** We are done ***
 9533:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 9534:         ],
 9535: 
 9536:     TesterSeq =
 9537:         [
 9538:          %% *** Init part ***
 9539:          #{desc => "monitor server",
 9540:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 9541:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 9542:                            ok
 9543:                    end},
 9544:          #{desc => "monitor client",
 9545:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 9546:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 9547:                            ok
 9548:                    end},
 9549: 
 9550:          %% Start the server
 9551:          #{desc => "order server start",
 9552:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 9553:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 9554:                            ok
 9555:                    end},
 9556:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
 9557:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 9558:                            {ok, ServerSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
 9559:                            {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}}
 9560:                    end},
 9561: 
 9562:          %% Start the client(s)
 9563:          #{desc => "order client start",
 9564:            cmd  => fun(#{client    := Pid,
 9565:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
 9566:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, ServerSA),
 9567:                            ok
 9568:                    end},
 9569:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
 9570:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 9571:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
 9572:                    end},
 9573: 
 9574:          %% The actual test
 9575:          #{desc => "order server continue (accept)",
 9576:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 9577:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 9578:                            ok
 9579:                    end},
 9580:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 9581:          #{desc => "order client continue (connect)",
 9582:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 9583:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect),
 9584:                            ok
 9585:                    end},
 9586:          #{desc => "await client ready (connect)",
 9587:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
 9588:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
 9589:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, connect,
 9590:                                             [{server, Server}]),
 9591:                            ok
 9592:                    end},
 9593:          #{desc => "await server ready (accept)",
 9594:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
 9595:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
 9596:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, accept,
 9597:                                             [{client, Client}]),
 9598:                            ok
 9599:                    end},
 9600: 
 9601:          #{desc => "order client continue (send)",
 9602:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid,
 9603:                          data   := Data} = _State) ->
 9604:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, send, Data),
 9605:                            ok
 9606:                    end},
 9607:          #{desc => "await client ready (send)",
 9608:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
 9609:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
 9610:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send,
 9611:                                             [{server, Server}]),
 9612:                            ok
 9613:                    end},
 9614: 
 9615:          #{desc => "order client continue (shutdown)",
 9616:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 9617:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, shutdown),
 9618:                            ok
 9619:                    end},
 9620:          #{desc => "await client ready (shutdown)",
 9621:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
 9622:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
 9623:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, shutdown,
 9624:                                             [{server, Server}]),
 9625:                            ok
 9626:                    end},
 9627: 
 9628:          #{desc => "order server continue (first recv)",
 9629:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 9630:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 9631:                            ok
 9632:                    end},
 9633:          #{desc => "await server ready (first recv)",
 9634:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
 9635:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
 9636:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv,
 9637:                                             [{client, Client}]),
 9638:                            ok
 9639:                    end},
 9640: 
 9641:          #{desc => "order server continue (second recv)",
 9642:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 9643:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 9644:                            ok
 9645:                    end},
 9646:          #{desc => "await server ready (second recv)",
 9647:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
 9648:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
 9649:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv,
 9650:                                             [{client, Client}]),
 9651:                            ok
 9652:                    end},
 9653: 
 9654:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 9655: 
 9656:          #{desc => "order client continue (close)",
 9657:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 9658:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 9659:                            ok
 9660:                    end},
 9661:          #{desc => "await client ready (close)",
 9662:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
 9663:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
 9664:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, close,
 9665:                                             [{server, Server}]),
 9666:                            ok
 9667:                    end},
 9668: 
 9669:          %% Terminations
 9670:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
 9671:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 9672:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 9673:                            ok
 9674:                    end},
 9675:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 9676:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
 9677:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 9678:                                ok ->
 9679:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client, State),
 9680:                                    {ok, State1};
 9681:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9682:                                    ERROR
 9683:                            end
 9684:                    end},
 9685:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
 9686:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 9687:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 9688:                            ok
 9689:                    end},
 9690:          #{desc => "await server termination",
 9691:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 9692:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 9693:                                ok ->
 9694:                                    State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 9695:                                    {ok, State1};
 9696:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9697:                                    ERROR
 9698:                            end
 9699:                    end},
 9700: 
 9701:          %% *** We are done ***
 9702:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 9703:         ],
 9704: 
 9705:     i("start server evaluator"),
 9706:     ServerInitState = #{domain => maps:get(domain, InitState),
 9707:                         proto  => maps:get(proto,  InitState),
 9708:                         recv   => maps:get(recv,   InitState)},
 9709:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 9710: 
 9711:     i("start client evaluator"),
 9712:     ClientInitState = #{host   => local_host(),
 9713:                         domain => maps:get(domain, InitState),
 9714:                         proto  => maps:get(proto,  InitState),
 9715:                         send   => maps:get(send, InitState)},
 9716:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 9717: 
 9718:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 9719:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
 9720:                         client => Client#ev.pid,
 9721:                         data   => maps:get(data, InitState)},
 9722:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 9723: 
 9724:     i("await evaluator"),
 9725:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
 9726: 
 9727: 
 9728: sc_rs_tcp_client_start(Node, Send) ->
 9729:     Self = self(),
 9730:     Fun  = fun() -> sc_rs_tcp_client(Self, Send) end,
 9731:     erlang:spawn(Node, Fun).
 9732: 
 9733: 
 9734: sc_rs_tcp_client(Parent, Send) ->
 9735:     sc_rs_tcp_client_init(Parent),
 9736:     {ServerSA, Proto} = sc_rs_tcp_client_await_start(Parent),
 9737:     Domain   = maps:get(family, ServerSA),
 9738:     Sock     = sc_rs_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto),
 9739:     Path     = sc_rs_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain),
 9740:     sc_rs_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, init),
 9741:     sc_rs_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, connect),
 9742:     sc_rs_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA),
 9743:     sc_rs_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, connect),
 9744:     Data = sc_rs_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, send),
 9745:     sc_rs_tcp_client_send(Sock, Send, Data),
 9746:     sc_rs_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, send),
 9747:     sc_rs_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, shutdown),
 9748:     sc_rs_tcp_client_shutdown(Sock),
 9749:     sc_rs_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, shutdown),
 9750:     sc_rs_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, close),
 9751:     sc_rs_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path),
 9752:     sc_rs_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, close),
 9753:     Reason = sc_rs_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent),
 9754:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminate"),
 9755:     exit(Reason).
 9756: 
 9757: sc_rs_tcp_client_init(Parent) ->
 9758:     put(sname, "rclient"),
 9759:     ?SEV_IPRINT("init"),
 9760:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 9761:     ok.
 9762: 
 9763: sc_rs_tcp_client_await_start(Parent) ->
 9764:     i("sc_rs_tcp_client_await_start -> entry"),
 9765:     ?SEV_AWAIT_START(Parent).
 9766: 
 9767: sc_rs_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto) ->
 9768:     i("sc_rs_tcp_client_create -> entry"),
 9769:     case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 9770:         {ok, Sock} ->
 9771:             Sock;
 9772:         {error, Reason} ->
 9773:             exit({open_failed, Reason})
 9774:     end.
 9775: 
 9776: sc_rs_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain) ->
 9777:     i("sc_rs_tcp_client_bind -> entry"),
 9778:     LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 9779:     case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 9780:         ok ->
 9781:             case socket:sockname(Sock) of
 9782:                 {ok, #{family := local, path := Path}} ->
 9783:                     Path;
 9784:                 {ok, _} ->
 9785:                     undefined;
 9786:                 {error, Reason1} ->
 9787:                     exit({sockname, Reason1})
 9788:             end;
 9789:         {error, Reason} ->
 9790:             exit({bind, Reason})
 9791:     end.
 9792: 
 9793: sc_rs_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan) ->
 9794:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan).
 9795: 
 9796: sc_rs_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, Slogan) ->
 9797:     i("sc_rs_tcp_client_await_continue -> entry"),
 9798:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan) of
 9799:         ok ->
 9800:             ok;
 9801:         {ok, Extra} ->
 9802:             Extra;
 9803:         {error, Reason} ->
 9804:             exit({await_continue, Slogan, Reason})
 9805:     end.
 9806: 
 9807: 
 9808: sc_rs_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA) ->
 9809:     i("sc_rs_tcp_client_connect -> entry"),
 9810:     case socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA) of
 9811:         ok ->
 9812:             ok;
 9813:         {error, Reason} ->
 9814:             exit({connect, Reason})
 9815:     end.
 9816: 
 9817: sc_rs_tcp_client_send(Sock, Send, Data) ->
 9818:     i("sc_rs_tcp_client_send -> entry"),
 9819:     try Send(Sock, Data) of
 9820:         ok ->
 9821:             ok;
 9822:         {error, Reason} ->
 9823:             exit({send, Reason})
 9824:     catch
 9825:         error : notsup = Reason : _ ->
 9826:             exit({skip, Reason})
 9827:     end.
 9828: 
 9829: sc_rs_tcp_client_shutdown(Sock) ->
 9830:     i("sc_rs_tcp_client_shutdown -> entry"),
 9831:     case socket:shutdown(Sock, write) of
 9832:         ok ->
 9833:             ok;
 9834:         {error, Reason} ->
 9835:             exit({shutdown, Reason})
 9836:     end.
 9837: 
 9838: sc_rs_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path) ->
 9839:     i("sc_rs_tcp_client_close -> entry"),
 9840:     case socket:close(Sock) of
 9841:         ok ->
 9842:             unlink_path(Path),
 9843:             ok;
 9844:         {error, Reason} ->
 9845:             ?SEV_EPRINT("failed closing: "
 9846:                         "~n   Reason: ~p", [Reason]),
 9847:             unlink_path(Path),
 9848:             {error, {close, Reason}}
 9849:     end.
 9850: 
 9851: sc_rs_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent) ->
 9852:     i("sc_rs_tcp_client_await_terminate -> entry"),
 9853:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, parent) of
 9854:         ok ->
 9855:             ok;
 9856:         {error, Reason} ->
 9857:             Reason
 9858:     end.
 9859: 
 9860: 
 9861: %% The handlers run on the same node as the server (the local node).
 9862: 
 9863: sc_rs_tcp_handler_start(Recv, Sock) ->
 9864:     Self     = self(),
 9865:     Fun      = fun() -> sc_rs_tcp_handler(Self, Recv, Sock) end,
 9866:     {Pid, _} = erlang:spawn_monitor(Fun),
 9867:     Pid.
 9868: 
 9869: sc_rs_tcp_handler(Parent, Recv, Sock) ->
 9870:     sc_rs_tcp_handler_init(Parent),
 9871:     sc_rs_tcp_handler_await(Parent, recv),
 9872:     ok = sc_rs_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock, true),
 9873:     sc_rs_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, recv, received),
 9874:     sc_rs_tcp_handler_await(Parent, recv),
 9875:     ok = sc_rs_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock, false),
 9876:     sc_rs_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, recv, closed),
 9877:     Reason = sc_rs_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate),
 9878:     exit(Reason).
 9879: 
 9880: sc_rs_tcp_handler_init(Parent) ->
 9881:     put(sname, "handler"),
 9882:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 9883:     ?SEV_IPRINT("started"),
 9884:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, init),
 9885:     ok.
 9886: 
 9887: sc_rs_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate) ->
 9888:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await terminate"),
 9889:     ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, tester);
 9890: sc_rs_tcp_handler_await(Parent, Slogan) ->
 9891:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w", [Slogan]),
 9892:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
 9893: 
 9894: %% This should actually work - we leave it for now
 9895: sc_rs_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock, First) ->
 9896:     ?SEV_IPRINT("recv"),
 9897:     try Recv(Sock) of
 9898:         {ok, _} when (First =:= true) ->
 9899:             ok;
 9900:         {error, closed} when (First =:= false) ->
 9901:             ok;
 9902:         {ok, _} ->
 9903:             ?SEV_IPRINT("unexpected success"),
 9904:             {error, unexpected_success};
 9905:         {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 9906:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive error: "
 9907:                         "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 9908:             ERROR
 9909:     catch
 9910:         error : notsup = Reason : _ ->
 9911:             exit({skip, Reason});
 9912:         C:E:S ->
 9913:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive failure: "
 9914:                         "~n   Class: ~p"
 9915:                         "~n   Error: ~p"
 9916:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 9917:             {error, {recv, C, E, S}}
 9918:     end.
 9919: 
 9920: sc_rs_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan, Result) ->
 9921:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready"),
 9922:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan, Result),
 9923:     ok.
 9924: 
 9925: 
 9926: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9927: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is
 9928: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
 9929: %% The remote client sends data, then shutdown(write) and then the
 9930: %% reader attempts a recv.
 9931: %% Socket is IPv4.
 9932: 
 9933: sc_rs_recvmsg_send_shutdown_receive_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 9934:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 9935:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 9936:            fun() ->
 9937:                    ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 9938:                    MsgData   = ?DATA,
 9939:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) ->
 9940:                                        case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
 9941:                                            {ok, #{iov   := [Data]}} ->
 9942:                                                {ok, Data};
 9943:                                            {ok, #{addr  := _} = Msg} ->
 9944:                                                {error, {msg, Msg}};
 9945:                                            {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9946:                                                ERROR
 9947:                                        end
 9948:                                end,
 9949:                    Send      = fun(Sock, Data) when is_binary(Data) ->
 9950:                                   Msg = #{iov => [Data]},
 9951:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
 9952:                                end,
 9953:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
 9954:                                  proto  => tcp,
 9955:                                  recv   => Recv,
 9956:                                  send   => Send,
 9957:                                  data   => MsgData},
 9958:                    ok = sc_rs_send_shutdown_receive_tcp(InitState)
 9959:            end).
 9960: 
 9961: 
 9962: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9963: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is
 9964: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
 9965: %% The remote client sends data, then shutdown(write) and then the
 9966: %% reader attempts a recv.
 9967: %% Socket is IPv6.
 9968: 
 9969: sc_rs_recvmsg_send_shutdown_receive_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 9970:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 9971:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 9972:            fun() ->
 9973:                    ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 9974:                    MsgData   = ?DATA,
 9975:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) ->
 9976:                                        case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
 9977:                                            {ok, #{iov   := [Data]}} ->
 9978:                                                {ok, Data};
 9979:                                            {ok, #{addr  := _} = Msg} ->
 9980:                                                {error, {msg, Msg}};
 9981:                                            {error, _} = ERROR ->
 9982:                                                ERROR
 9983:                                        end
 9984:                                end,
 9985:                    Send      = fun(Sock, Data) when is_binary(Data) ->
 9986:                                        Msg = #{iov => [Data]},
 9987:                                        socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
 9988:                                end,
 9989:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
 9990:                                  proto  => tcp,
 9991:                                  recv   => Recv,
 9992:                                  send   => Send,
 9993:                                  data   => MsgData},
 9994:                    ok = sc_rs_send_shutdown_receive_tcp(InitState)
 9995:            end).
 9996: 
 9997: 
 9998: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9999: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is
10000: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
10001: %% The remote client sends data, then shutdown(write) and then the
10002: %% reader attempts a recv.
10003: %% Socket is UNix Domain (stream) socket.
10004: 
10005: sc_rs_recvmsg_send_shutdown_receive_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
10006:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
10007:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
10008:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
10009:            fun() ->
10010:                    {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
10011:                    ?SEV_IPRINT("CWD: ~s", [CWD]),
10012:                    MsgData   = ?DATA,
10013:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) ->
10014:                                        case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
10015:                                            %% On some platforms, the address
10016:                                            %% *is* provided (e.g. linux)
10017:                                            {ok, #{addr  := #{family := local},
10018:                                                   iov   := [Data]}} ->
10019:                                                {ok, Data};
10020:                                            {ok, #{addr := _} = Msg} ->
10021:                                                {error, {msg, Msg}};
10022:                                            %% On some platforms, the address
10023:                                            %% is *not* provided (e.g. FreeBSD)
10024:                                            {ok, #{iov   := [Data]}} ->
10025:                                                {ok, Data};
10026:                                            {ok, Msg} ->
10027:                                                {error, {msg, Msg}};
10028:                                            {error, _} = ERROR ->
10029:                                                ERROR
10030:                                        end
10031:                                end,
10032:                    Send      = fun(Sock, Data) when is_binary(Data) ->
10033:                                        Msg = #{iov => [Data]},
10034:                                        socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
10035:                                end,
10036:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
10037:                                  proto  => default,
10038:                                  recv   => Recv,
10039:                                  send   => Send,
10040:                                  data   => MsgData},
10041:                    ok = sc_rs_send_shutdown_receive_tcp(InitState)
10042:            end).
10043:
